0.title: Manish Malhotra shares pic of Alia in her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make
0.article_body: Fashion designer Manish Malhotra shared a picture of Alia Bhatt wearing her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make. "Alia...chose to personalise [the] ensemble with...sustainable approach...where approximately 180 textiles patches come together to mark her momentous occasion," he wrote. "The custom touches reminisce about her journey and depict symbolic elements of her memories," he added.

1.title: TV actor Vivian to marry ex-journalist from Egypt, 5 years after his split with Vahbiz
1.article_body: TV actor Vivian Dsena has revealed that he is planning to tie the knot with Nouran Aly, a former journalist from Egypt. "We first interacted around four-and-a-half years ago, when she contacted me for an interview," Vivian said. Vivian was earlier married to TV actress Vahbiz Dorabjee. They split five years ago and finalised their divorce in December 2021.

2.title: Blue is the only jersey missing: Harbhajan on SRH pacer Umran Malik
2.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has termed SRH's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik as the "most deserving one" among the uncapped players to be selected for India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Blue is the only jersey missing and he should get it early...He could be your match-winner [in Australia]," stated Harbhajan. Umran has picked nine wickets in six games this season.

3.title: Attacks on processions designed way to divide country: JP Nadda
3.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Sunday said that the Congress party is behaving in the most irresponsible manner. Addressing the party workers in Karnataka's Hosapete, Nadda said, "You must have seen the attacks on Ram Navami procession or something else at some other place...I can say it's a designed way to divide the country," Nadda added.

4.title: Rahul Gandhi lacks stability, can't be entrusted with responsibilities: PJ Kurien
4.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is a leader who has “no stability” and cannot be entrusted with responsibilities, senior party leader PJ Kurien said. "The captain cannot leave the ship when it is in trouble. After the 2019 elections, he resigned abruptly from the post (of Congress chief). But, he continues to take important decisions in the party," Kurien added.

5.title: Met Salman as kid; he was eating from tandoor, mom made us stand with him: Neha
5.article_body: Singer Neha Bhasin said that she first met actor Salman Khan when she was a child. In an interview with Bollywood Hungama, she said that she has picture of the meeting and that Salman was standing near a tandoor and eating something from it. "My mom made us stand with him. Me and my sister were looking silly," she added.

6.title: Aamir dances to Dhol Jageero Da with influencer Ruhee Dosani, she shares video
6.article_body: Social media influencer Ruhee Dosani took to Instagram to share a video of herself dancing with Aamir Khan to the song 'Dhol Jageero Da'. Aamir had invited Ruhee and her family to his house. "Still don't know how to...process the fact that Aamir sir was so kind to agree to spend time with my family to celebrate Vaisakhi," Ruhee wrote.

7.title: 2 killed, 17 injured in separate shootings in US
7.article_body: Two people were killed and at least 17 injured in two separate incidents of mass shooting in US over the Easter weekend. A shooting at a nightclub in South Carolina left nine people injured, while another in Pittsburgh left two dead and eight wounded. These happened a day after 14 people were injured in a shooting incident in South Carolina.

8.title: After silver, Madhavan's son Vedaant wins gold at Danish Open; actor shares video
8.article_body: Actor R Madhavan's son Vedaant has bagged a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. Vedaant won the medal in the 800 m swimming event and clocked 8:17:28. Sharing a video of the felicitation ceremony, Madhavan wrote, "GOLD….With all your blessings and God's greatest...winning streak continues." Earlier, he had won a silver medal in a different category.

9.title: 'Social Media Lab' activated in Maha, 3,000 posts inciting communal tensions deleted
9.article_body: Mumbai Police on Monday said that a 'Social Media Lab' has been activated to keep a vigil on posts that could incite communal tensions in Maharashtra. Mumbai Police added that around 3,000 such posts have been deleted till now. Notably, Maharashtra government has decided to allow the use of loudspeakers at religious sites only with due permission, ANI reported.

10.title: Prince Narula to enter Kangana Ranaut's show 'Lock Upp'
10.article_body: Prince Narula is all set to enter Kangana Ranaut-hosted show 'Lock Upp'. The actor, who had earlier won 'Bigg Boss 9' and 'Roadies 12', said, "I am entering the show as a troublemaker and not a contestant." "I am very excited. Lock Upp is a different show...My main reason to enter this show is that it is judgment-free," Prince added.

11.title: Delhi Capitals under quarantine following COVID-19 scare: Reports
11.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) have cancelled their scheduled travel to Pune ahead of their next IPL 2022 match amid COVID-19 scare, Cricbuzz reported. Their players and support staff will be quarantined in their rooms, the report added. DC's physio Patrick Farhart had tested positive for the virus. As per reports, a player has now tested positive following a Rapid Antigen Test.

12.title: Akash Singh wins 'Hunarbaaz...' trophy, ₹15 lakh prize; says 'it feels surreal'
12.article_body: Akash Singh has become the first winner of 'Hunarbaaz Desh Ki Shaan' and bagged a trophy and cash prize of ₹15 lakh. Speaking about winning the show, Akash said, "I can't find the words to express the emotions...I'm going through, and it...feels so surreal!" "I want to thank my family and friends for...supporting me in this life-changing journey," he added.

13.title: Police shoot 3 after riots break out over Quran burning in Sweden
13.article_body: Three people were shot and injured by police in Sweden's Norrkoping city after riots broke out following reports of burning of the Quran by a politician. "Three people seem to have been hit by ricochets and are now being cared for in hospital. All three injured are arrested on suspicion of crime," said police, adding, the injuries were not life-threatening.

14.title: I still get messages about 'October', how it changed someone's life: Banita
14.article_body: Actress Banita Sandhu said that she still gets messages about her movie 'October'. " And [about] how it moved them deeply or changed someone's life. It is really gratifying as an artist to be a part of a film that is so timeless that it still speaks to audiences years later," she said, adding she looks up to Deepika Padukone.

15.title: Man beats partner's 3-year-old daughter to death in Pune; arrested
15.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly beating his partner's three-year-old daughter to death in Pune. "Our preliminary probe suggests that the accused resented the child since she was born out of a previous relationship," an officer said. According to the FIR, the man banged the child's head against the wall. The girl's mother filed a complaint last week.

16.title: 19 arrested as road accident causes communal clashes in Guj; 3 hurt
16.article_body: As many as 19 people have been arrested after a minor road accident between people from two communities caused clashes in Gujarat's Vadodara, the police said on Monday. The miscreants pelted stones, damaged vehicles and also vandalised a shrine, the police added. Three people who were injured have been admitted to a hospital, the city's Police Commissioner Shamsher Singh said.

17.title: Comedian Munawar Faruqui reveals his mother died by suicide in 2007
17.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui, in an episode of 'Lock Upp', revealed his mother died by suicide in 2007.  "I always think things may have been different had I slept with my mom that night...had I reached the hospital earlier," he said. "For 22 years of her married life...my mom wasn't happy. All my life...I saw her being beaten up," he added.

18.title: 16-yr-old boy gets 36 stitches as 2 men stab him after failed robbery attempt
18.article_body: A 16-year-old boy received 36 stitches after two bike-borne men stabbed him after a failed robbery attempt in Bengaluru. The  robbers were following the victim when he was returning home from an eatery. They stopped boy to ask for his valuables. When he denied having anything, robbers forcefully stripped him. When the boy resisted, they stabbed him and ran away.

19.title: Infosys shares fall 9% in intra-day trade post Q4 results, its biggest fall in 2 yrs
19.article_body: Infosys' shares dropped 9% to ₹1592.05 on the BSE in Monday's intra-day trade owing to its weak Q4 results, making this its biggest fall in the market in two years. The plunge wiped out ₹47,907.7 crore from its market valuation. Earlier on March 23, 2020, Infosys plunged 12% in the intra-day trade on the BSE.

20.title: Stunning partnership: Raina on Ruturaj, Rayudu adding 92 runs vs GT
20.article_body: Ex-CSK batter Suresh Raina took to Twitter to praise CSK batters Ruturaj Gaikwad and Ambati Rayudu for adding 92 runs for the third wicket against GT. Raina also congratulated Rayudu for crossing the 4000-run mark in the IPL. "It was so great to see such a stunning partnership," he tweeted. Ruturaj smashed 73(48) while Rayudu scored 46(31) in the game.

21.title: Zoya Akhtar's 'Archies' starring Suhana, Khushi & Agastya goes on floor
21.article_body: Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar on Monday began shooting for her upcoming Netflix live-action musical film 'The Archies'. The film reportedly features Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan, Boney Kapoor's daughter Khushi Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda in the lead roles. Sharing a picture of a clapboard, producer Reema Kagti wrote, "Archie's shoot starts."

22.title: Punjab officer to give part of salary to daughters of farmers dying by suicide
22.article_body: Senior Superintendent of Police, Mandeep Singh Sidhu has decided to contribute part of his salary for education of daughters of farmers who die by suicide. Sidhu has been posted in Sangrur for the third time and decided to contribute Rs 51,000 from his first pay followed by Rs 21,000 every month till the time he is posted in the area.

23.title: 3 men arrested for ATM fraud in Ludhiana, 31 cards recovered
23.article_body: Three men were arrested on Sunday, two days after a woman’s debit card was swapped with a fake one at an ATM on Sua Road, Ludhiana. As many as 31 stolen cards were recovered from them. "The accused would target ATMs without a security guard, and offer to help those facing trouble carrying out transactions," ADCP, BS Randhawa, said.

24.title: Permission needed to use loudspeakers at religious sites: Maharashtra govt
24.article_body: Maharashtra has decided to allow the use of loudspeakers at religious sites only with due permission, reported ANI. State Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil will hold a meeting with the DGP to instruct him to direct police commissioners and officers on this on Monday. It comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray gave May 3 as ultimatum to remove mosque loudspeakers.

25.title: Cong members booked for unlawful assembly at K'taka CM's B'luru home
25.article_body: A case has been filed against 36 Congress members, including former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, state party chief DK Shivakumar and party General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala, in Bengaluru on charges of unlawful assembly at state CM Basavaraj Bommai's residence. The party members have been booked under IPC Sections 341, 143 and KP Act Section 103, the ANI reported.

26.title: SC cancels Ashish Mishra's bail in Lakhimpur case, asks him to surrender
26.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday cancelled the bail granted to Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra, an accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. The top court has also asked Ashish to surrender within a week. Earlier, the SC had raised questions over the Allahabad High Court granting bail to Ashish on February 10.

27.title: That over was the game-changer: Miller on Rashid hitting Jordan for 3 sixes
27.article_body: GT batter David Miller, who scored 94* off 51 balls against CSK, said that their stand-in captain Rashid Khan's batting in their 18th over was the game-changing moment in the match. GT needed 48 in the last three overs when Rashid smashed Chris Jordan for three sixes and a four. Overall, GT scored 25 runs in the 18th over.

28.title: Rajkummar to reunite with Anubhav for anthology set against pandemic: Report
28.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao and filmmaker Anubhav Sinha are reportedly teaming up again, after 'Bheed', for an anthology that is set against the backdrop of COVID-19 pandemic. "The director felt Rajkummar is someone who connects with the movie on a personal level," report stated. The anthology will feature short films by Sudhir Mishra, Hansal Mehta, Ketan Mehta and other filmmakers.

29.title: 18-yr-old boxer Ali Tazeem, dubbed 'next Amir Khan', passes away in car accident in UK
29.article_body: UK's 18-year-old boxer Ali Tazeem, dubbed the 'next Amir Khan', passed away in a car accident. Tazeem had signed his professional contract with Probellum three weeks ago. Tazeem won 15 gold medals from 51 bouts as an amateur. "The skill-set he has...the movement...everything...reminds me of myself when I was younger," boxer Amir Khan had said about Ali.

30.title: Greater Noida sectors, called after Greek alphabets, to be renamed
30.article_body: The Greater Noida Authority is reportedly planning to rename the city's sectors that are currently called after Greek alphabets like Alpha, Beta, Gamma, Delta and Omicron. GNIDA said it is being done to streamline the city's "complex and mismanaged naming system". However, some residents said it may have something to do with the association of those alphabets with COVID-19 variants.

31.title: To the most amazing wife & mom: David Beckham on Victoria's b'day
31.article_body: Actor David Beckham wished his wife Victoria Beckham on her birthday. Taking to Instagram, he shared a throwback picture of them kissing and wrote, "Happy Birthday to the most amazing wife, mummy and businesswoman." He further wrote, "Have the most amazing day because you deserve to...We all love you so much."

32.title: Delhi Metro to expand its existing depots for Phase 4 sections
32.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has decided not to acquire additional land but will expand the capacity of the existing Mukundpur depot to meet the requirements of the upcoming stations of Phase IV. According to a DMRC official, the expansion will provide space for the extension of the Pink Line and the Magenta line.

33.title: Okinawa outlet in Tamil Nadu goes up in flames after electric scooter catches fire
33.article_body: An Okinawa dealership in Tamil Nadu went up in flames after an e-scooter parked in the outlet reportedly caught fire. While the entire showroom was gutted, no casualties were reported and the fire was put out with the help of locals. Before this incident, Okinawa announced a recall of 3,215 units of its 'Praise Pro' scooters to fix battery-related issues.

34.title: It is clear that BJP itself is behind Jahangirpuri violence: AAP
34.article_body: AAP on Sunday alleged that considering the recent events, it is "clear" that BJP is behind the violence that broke out in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta had honoured "goons" who were arrested for vandalising the national capital's CM's residence, it said. "When you...honour such goons you send a message...that you're on the side of violence," it added.

35.title: COVID-19 positivity rate rises to 15% in Noida
35.article_body: With COVID-19 cases rising in the NCR, the positivity rate in Noida has reportedly increased to 15%. The authorities said that precautionary measures are being taken. "There is no need to panic yet. The active cases have increased but it is important to note that there is not a single person who has been hospitalised," said Gautam Buddha Nagar DM.

36.title: XYXX teams up with KL Rahul, says 'Tune out the noise to play your way'
36.article_body: XYXX has teamed up with KL Rahul aiming to break new boundaries with the 'Play Your Way' campaign. "In a world filled with fake news and hype, XYXX's game-changing campaign encourages everyone to listen to their inner voice, trust their instincts," KL Rahul said. XYXX designs products that seek to challenge the status quo in innerwear and comfort wear segment.

37.title: Shanghai reports first COVID-19 deaths since start of lockdown
37.article_body:
Shanghai has reported the first COVID-19 deaths since the start of its weeks-long lockdown.
Three people died on Sunday, according to Shanghai's municipal government. They were aged between 89 and 91, had underlying diseases and were all unvaccinated, according to reports. Shanghai reported more than 22,000 COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

38.title: Abhishek said he follows music passion in dad's basement set-up: Dasvi composer
38.article_body: One of the composers of the movie 'Dasvi', Sachin Sanghvi, said that actor Abhishek Bachchan told him and composer Jigar Saraiya that music has been a major part of his life. "He shared that Amitabh Bachchan sir has a small set-up in the basement of their residence where he still pursues music as a passion," Sachin added.

39.title: PM should directly intervene: RJD MP Manoj Jha on Delhi violence
39.article_body: RJD MP Manoj Jha has urged PM Narendra Modi to directly intervene and give a "strong message" in regards to the recent Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi. "The Jahangirpuri incident isn't isolated. If you look at the images of different places...then there is a pattern. I request PM for his direct intervention...give a strong message," Jha said.

40.title: Video shows thieves hitting woman with their car as she flees robbery in US
40.article_body: The US police have released a video that captured the moment when a woman, who was escaping from a robbery attempt, was hit by a car driven by thieves. It showed the accused jumping out of the car to snatch her watch after hitting her with their car. She was being followed after she left a jewellery store, police added.

41.title: People have not seen me in this kind of part: Sharad on 'Operation Romeo'
41.article_body: Sharad Kelkar, speaking about his upcoming project 'Operation Romeo', said that it's an important movie in his career as it'll give fans an opportunity to see him in a "gritty" role. "People haven't seen me in this kind of part so it's like reinvention," he added. Directed by Shashant Shah, the film is the remake of 2019 Malayalam film 'Ishq'.

42.title: CIA arrests 2 persons with pistol, live cartridges in Mohali
42.article_body: The Crime Investigation Agency (CIA) of Mohali district police arrested two persons and recovered a .315 bore pistol and two live cartridges from them. The accused allegedly came to the city to commit a crime. The police suspect that they could have links with some of the gangs operating in the state. Both the accused belong to the Hoshiarpur district.

43.title: India sees 2,183 new COVID-19 cases, 90% rise in daily cases
43.article_body: India has reported 2,183 new COVID-19 cases and 214 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Kerala reported 213 deaths including 151 deaths during the day and 62 reconciled deaths and Uttar Pradesh reported one death, according to government. It comes a day after the country saw 1,150 cases and four deaths.

44.title: Raghav gets legal notice for calling BJP 'Gundon-Lafangon ki party'
44.article_body: Punjab Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha leader Ashok Sareen sent a legal notice to AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Sunday for calling BJP "Gundon ki, Lafangon ki party" and "Bharat ki Zahil Party". The notice demanded that Chadha issue a written apology to Sareen and BJP within three days, failing which a civil and criminal complaint would be filed against him.

45.title: I needed to step up, take responsibility: Rashid on scoring 40(21) vs CSK
45.article_body: GT stand-in captain Rashid Khan said he wanted two batters to score big in their chase of CSK's 170-run target and he needed to step up and take the responsibility after they were reduced to 87/5 after 13 overs. Rashid scored 40 off 21 balls while David Miller smashed 94*(51) to help GT win the game by three wickets.

46.title: Chris Jordan gives away most runs by a CSK bowler in a match in IPL 2022
46.article_body: CSK's bowling all-rounder Chris Jordan gave away most runs by a CSK bowler in an IPL 2022 match after conceding 58 runs against GT. Jordan registered figures of 3.5-0-58-0. He conceded four sixes and five fours in his spell. Before Jordan, pacer Mukesh Choudhary had conceded the most runs (4-0-52-1) by a CSK bowler in an IPL 2022 match.

47.title: Sensex crashes 1,000 points in early trade, Nifty below 17,200
47.article_body: The Sensex tanked over 1,000 points in early trade on Monday while the NSE Nifty 50 dipped below 17,200 amid weak global cues. The indices reopened on April 18 after a gap of four straight days on account of public holidays. Infosys and HDFC Bank tanked 6% and 2.4% respectively, on account of their Q4 earnings.

48.title: Miller played a blinder, so did Rashid: GT's Abhinav Manohar on win vs CSK
48.article_body: GT batter Abhinav Manohar, who scored 12(12) against CSK, said he didn't move from his place when David Miller and stand-in captain Rashid Khan batted while chasing the 170-run target. "Miller played a blinder, and so did Rashid. I was sitting in the same place," he stated. Miller smashed 94*(51) while Rashid scored 40(21) to help GT defeat CSK.

49.title: BJP is trying to divide society: Kamal Nath on Khargone violence
49.article_body: Following the clashes that took place in MP’s Khargone, former MP CM and Congress leader Kamal Nath on Sunday said that BJP is trying to "divide" the society. "These riots that took place in Khargone are against the culture of our country. Our culture is to unite the society but BJP is trying to divide it," Nath added.

50.title: You've to be ready for rejections in Mumbai; wait is endless, crushing: Sonu
50.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood said that in a city like Mumbai, one has to be ready for a lot of rejections and people not giving dues. "The wait is endless, it is crushing and extremely demanding. That's when you need to survive and face those challenges. You just have to be there, patiently, waiting for your turn to shine," he added.

51.title: Mahesh Babu buys electric car Audi e-tron worth ₹1.19 crore, shares pic
51.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu has bought electric car Audio e-tron which is worth around ₹1.19 crore. "Bringing a clean, green and sustainable future home," he wrote on Instagram while sharing a picture. The car is Audi's first all-electric model to be launched in India. The car is equipped with a 95 kWh battery pack and a dual motor setup.

52.title: Divyansh-Manuraj crowned winners of India's Got Talent Season 9, win ₹20-lakh cash prize
52.article_body: Beatboxer Divyansh and flautist Manuraj have been crowned the winners of India's Got Talent Season 9. The duo won a cash prize of ₹20 lakh and a car. First runner-up Ishita Vishwakarma and second runner-up Bomb Fire Crew took home cash prize of  ₹5 lakh each. Divyansh hails from Jaipur, while Manuraj is from Bharatpur.

53.title: RCB's Harshal Patel shares pic with sister who passed away, pens note
53.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with his sister who passed away during IPL 2022. He wrote, "Didi...You were one of the kindest and most joyful person in our lives. You faced incredible difficulties...with a big smile...till your last breath." He added, "I'll continue to do everything that made you proud of me."

54.title: 15-yr-old boy pushed into Mula river from Bopodi bridge in Pune
54.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was reportedly pushed into the Mula river from Bopodi railway bridge in Pune on Saturday. The accused was known to the victim, according to police. The victim's mother claimed that the accused told her son that he would show him parrot chicks under the bridge and then pushed him down. The boy was rescued by a boat.

55.title: I'll buy bulldozer someday, demolish stone-pelters' houses: Pundit Dhirendra
55.article_body: Pundit Dhirendra Krishna Shastri of Bageshwar Dham has reportedly urged Hindus to "demolish houses of stone-pelters". "Wake up, cowards! Demolish the houses of stone-pelters otherwise they'll come for you next," he said, adding, "If they pelt stones at your house, you bulldoze their houses. I'll also buy a bulldozer someday and demolish the houses of those stone-pelters."

56.title: Pune RTO revenue exceeded pre-pandemic level in 2021
56.article_body: The revenue of Pune's Regional Transport Office (RTO) exceeded the pre-COVID-19 pandemic level in 2021, according to government data. The revenue, mainly generated through vehicle registrations, reached ₹1,027 crore in 2021, up from ₹1,020 crore seen in 2019. "With the situation improving and curbs being relaxed, revenue generation has returned to normal," said an RTO officer.

57.title: 18-year-old table tennis player D Vishwa dies as 12-wheel trailer hits car
57.article_body: Deenadayalan Vishwa, one of the top Tamil Nadu table tennis players, passed away in a road accident on Sunday, while travelling by road from Guwahati to Shillong for the 83rd Senior National and Inter-State Table Tennis Championship. The accident reportedly occurred when the Swift Desire car in which the 18-year-old player was travelling was hit by a 12-wheel trailer.

58.title: My 2nd wife wanted me to quit DJing & be an actor: Lock Upp's Ali on divorce
58.article_body: On Sunday's episode of the reality show, 'Lock Upp', contestant Ali Mercchant revealed that he got married for the second time, in 2016 and got divorced in December 2021. Ali said his second wife did not want him to be a DJ. "She wanted me to quit DJing and be an actor...Our life philosophies did not match," he added.

59.title: These are all rumours: Jubin Nautiyal on dating Nikita Dutta
59.article_body: Singer Jubin Nautiyal has said that the reports of him dating actress Nikita Dutta are just rumours. "Nikita is a very, very dear friend of mine," he added. Jubin further said though his parents remained unfazed by the rumours, he had to spend a considerable amount of time explaining to his relatives that he hadn't gotten secretly engaged to Nikita.

60.title: Teen falls to death from waterfall while clicking selfie in Pune
60.article_body: Police and rescue teams on Sunday recovered the body of an 18-year-old boy, a day after he fell into Kund Mala waterfall in Pune while clicking a selfie. The body was found stuck in the water hyacinth and was retrieved, officials said. According to police, six students of Indira College, including the deceased, had gone to visit the waterfall.

61.title: Neetu shares pic with Ranbir & son-in-law Bharat; calls them her 'pillars'
61.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture with her son, actor Ranbir Kapoor and her son-in-law Bharat Sahni. The picture was from Ranbir-Alia Bhatt's wedding ceremony. While sharing the post, she wrote, "My pillars." As soon as she posted the photo, fans took to the comments section, and wrote, "Congratulations Neetu ji." Another user wrote, "Two sons."

62.title: Man demands change of Indian flag at Bengaluru station, tags city police
62.article_body: A Twitter user has demanded changing of the Indian flag at the KSR Bengaluru Railway Station. "The flag appears to be damaged at the top," he wrote in his tweet. The Bengaluru Police replied to his tweet saying that they have forwarded his concern to the South Western Railway for any necessary action to be taken.

63.title: Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan attend Baba Siddique’s annual Iftaar party, pics surface
63.article_body: Actors Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan and Sanjay Dutt attended Indian politician Baba Siddique's annual Iftaar party at Hotel Taj Lands End in Mumbai's Bandra. Baba Siddique hosted the party after a gap of two years owing to the COVID-19 pandemic. Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Kaur Sandhu also attended the party.

64.title: Ravindra Jadeja gets angry at Shivam Dube over fielding, video goes viral
64.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja got angry at Shivam Dube after he didn't attempt GT batter David Miller's catch in their IPL 2022 encounter on Sunday. Dube was fielding at deep mid-wicket in the 17th over bowled by Dwayne Bravo when Miller lofted the ball towards him. Jadeja almost threw his cap in anger as Dube didn't go for the catch.

65.title: Conor McGregor shares pics of his physical transformation over the years
65.article_body: Former UFC featherweight and lightweight champion Conor McGregor took to Instagram to share pictures of his physical transformation over the years. "Climb the ladder," he captioned the post. "That’s actually insane the way he was able to dominate different weight classes like that," a fan commented on the post. "2014-2016 was the golden age," another fan wrote.

66.title: Nepal considering 2-day holiday for govt offices to reduce fuel consumption
66.article_body: Nepal is considering declaring a two-day holiday in public offices this month to reduce fuel consumption as its prices surge. The Ukraine war has caused a spike in global oil prices as Russian oil faces sanctions. Amid its foreign exchange crisis, Nepal has urged its citizens living abroad to open dollar accounts in banks in the country and make investments.

67.title: Did well in 1st 6 overs, but failed to execute plans in last 5 vs GT: Jadeja
67.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said they failed to execute their plans in the last five overs while defending their 169-run total against GT on Sunday. "We started brilliantly...we did well in the first 6 overs...I thought Chris Jordan could execute his yorkers [in the final over]...but he couldn't do so," stated Jadeja. CSK lost the match by three wickets.

68.title: Man asks Hyd Police to allow guests in wedding, says 'food will be wasted'
68.article_body: A Twitter user shared a picture from his wedding and said that the Hyderabad Police were stopping guests "for some reason". "We have invited 700 people for our wedding happening now in Vedika convention centre, Jal Vihar...Kindly allow us to perform our wedding and [let] the guests enter and bless the couple else the food will be wasted," tweet read.

69.title: KGF is a horror film for Bollywood, they will have nightmares for years: RGV
69.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to talk about KGF's success and said that it is a "horror film" for the Bollywood industry and they will have nightmares about its success for years to come. "@TheNameIsYash is literally machine gunning all...Bollywood stars opening collections and its final collections will be...nuclear bomb thrown on Bollywood from Sandalwood," he tweeted.

70.title: Anupam Kher shares pics showing his physical transformation; fans react
70.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher on Sunday took to Instagram to share pictures of his physical transformation. He wrote, "Your desire to change must be greater than your desire to stay the same! Being fit doesn’t begin in the gym with a dumbbell; it starts with a decision in your head!" Commenting on his post, a user wrote, "What a transformation sir!"

71.title: NCP MP Amol Kolhe dances at staffer's wedding in Pune, video surfaces
71.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows Nationalist Congress Party MP Amol Kolhe dancing on dhol beats at a wedding ceremony in Pune district of Maharashtra. Kolhe was reportedly dancing at the wedding of his staffer Tejas Zodage in Narayangaon. The Member of Parliament was wearing a white ethnic attire on the occasion.

72.title: David Miller smashes 94*(51) as GT hand CSK their 5th defeat in IPL 2022
72.article_body: GT batter David Miller smashed an unbeaten 94 off 51 deliveries as his team chased down the 170-run target in 19.5 overs against CSK. GT have now won five matches in IPL 2022, while CSK have now lost five out of their first six matches. CSK fast bowler Chris Jordan conceded 58 runs in 3.5 overs.

73.title: Aaditya Thackeray to visit Ram Temple site in Ayodhya in May
73.article_body: Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray will be on a one-day visit to UP's Ayodhya in the first week of May during which he'll be going to the Ram Janambhoomi site. This comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray confirmed that he will visit Ayodhya on June 5. Notably, MNS and Shiv Sena are involved in a row over loudspeakers outside mosques.

74.title: Products of 30,000 small brands cater to 80% of population: Survey
74.article_body: A Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) survey showed household products of over 30,000 brands operating at small and medium scale cater to 80% of India's population. Big brands are in demand among people of higher and upper-middle classes, CAIT Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said. "It's a myth that about 3,000 big brands...are catering to the people's needs," he added.

75.title: Was a strong performance: Williamson on SRH's win against PBKS
75.article_body: After SRH's seven-wicket win against PBKS in IPL 2022, SRH skipper Kane Williamson praised his team for putting "strong performance" at DY Patil Stadium. "So far, we've managed to put out some strong performances...we'll continue to try...improve and put out better ones," he stated. This is fourth consecutive win for SRH, which have taken them to fourth spot in standings.

76.title: J&K's Tulip Garden to shut a week early due to high temperature
76.article_body: The Tulip Garden in J&K's Srinagar which is one of its major tourist attractions will be closing on Monday, a week ahead of the usual time. "We are closing early this season as the bloom has reduced due to high temperatures," the garden's in-charge Sofi Inam-ur-Rehman said. The flowers require temperatures between 15 and 25 degrees Celsius to bloom.

77.title: Jet fuel price up 0.2%, touches all-time high after 2022's 8th hike
77.article_body: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, was hiked by 0.2% on Saturday to an all-time high on the back of rising global oil prices. ATF now costs ₹1,13,202.33/kl in Delhi, ₹1,11,981.99/kl in Mumbai and ₹1,17,753.6/kl in Kolkata. In eight hikes beginning January 1, ATF prices have been increased by ₹39,180.42, or almost 50%.

78.title: We were 30-40 runs short, lost many wickets early: Dhawan on PBKS' loss
78.article_body: PBKS stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan said his side lost too many wickets early and were 30-40 runs short in their seven-wicket loss against SRH in IPL. "Once we lost too many wickets then we had to take the game deep," he added. PBKS were reduced to 61/4 after eight overs and lost five wickets on last seven balls of innings.

79.title: Delhi violence accused does Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa' gesture while being taken to court
79.article_body: A video has shown one of the accused in the Jahangirpuri Delhi violence case doing Allu Arjun's popular hand gesture from the movie 'Pushpa' while being taken to court on Sunday. In the video that is being widely shared online, one of the key accused Ansar was seen doing the signature move while smiling at the camera recording him.

80.title: Turkey condemns Israeli action against Palestinians in Jerusalem
80.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Sunday condemned the Israeli Police's action against the Palestinians during recent clashes inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound. "Turkey always stands with Palestine," he added. Notably, Erdoğan's comments come amid efforts by Turkey and Israel in recent weeks to normalise their long-strained ties, according to Reuters.

81.title: Mahindra praises Mumbai's new bus stops with exercise bars, 'cool' green tops
81.article_body: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday took to Twitter to share a video about 105 Mumbai bus stops that are set to be revamped. The new bus stops will be cleaner, safer, sleeker, and feature plant-covered roofs and exercise bars. "Terrific to also see innovative features like the exercise bar & the 'cool' green tops," Mahindra tweeted.

82.title: Success in industry is how long you can hold breath underwater: Sonu
82.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has stated that success in the film industry is how long you can hold your breath underwater. He added that the wait to get your due is endless, crushing and extremely demanding. "I have been trying to hold my breath all these years. Maybe now it's time to come up and say, 'Hey, I exist'," he said.

83.title: Cell to be formed to resolve issues of U'khand's migrant residents: CM
83.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami met with the migrant residents of the state and said that a cell would be formed in Dehradun to solve their problems. "Through this cell, along with resolving the problems of the migrants, efforts will be made to implement their suggestions related to the interest of the state," he said.

84.title: Gujarat groom receives lemons as wedding gift amid rising prices
84.article_body: A groom in Gujarat's Rajkot was given lemons as a gift during a wedding ceremony by his friends and relatives amid rising prices of the commodity. Explaining the reason behind the gift, a relative said, "At this time, the prices of lemons in the state and...country have gone up a lot. There's a lot of need for lemons this season."

85.title: Hardik has ticked all boxes with his performance in IPL so far: Jaffer
85.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said GT captain Hardik Pandya has answered all the questions regarding his form and fitness by ticking all the boxes with his performance in the ongoing IPL so far. "Among all...captains that have led for the first time, Hardik has impressed me the most," he added. Hardik has scored 228 runs and taken four wickets in five matches.

86.title: Migrant shot dead while crossing into Greece from Turkey: Police
86.article_body: A migrant was shot dead at the border on Saturday while attempting to enter Greece from Turkey on an inflatable dinghy, the Greek Police said on Sunday. However, it wasn't immediately clear who fired the shot that killed the woman. A Greek police officer claimed that a "barrage" of shots was fired from the Turkish side.

87.title: BCCI aims to start women's IPL with 6 teams next year: Report
87.article_body: BCCI is reportedly planning to start women's Indian Premier League (IPL) from next year and it is expected to feature six teams. "We have already started working on the plan as to how many teams we can have and what window is going to suit, because we have the men's IPL as well," said a BCCI source.

88.title: K'taka woman kills 6-month-old son, hangs self after husband dies
88.article_body: A 30-year old woman in Karnataka's Mangaluru allegedly killed her six-month-old son by strangulating him with a saree before hanging herself to death. The woman, who was staying at her brother's house, reportedly took this step after learning about her husband's sudden death. According to police, her 36-year-old husband died after being hit by an SUV while crossing a road.

89.title: AAP must clarify if it supports UK MP's anti-India views: BJP leader
89.article_body: BJP leader and ex-Army chief JJ Singh said Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) must clarify if it supports the "pro-separatist and anti-India" views of British Labour Party MP Tanmanjeet Singh Dhesi. This comes after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and AAP Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha met Dhesi on Friday. Singh added that Mann must disclose what transpired during their meeting.

90.title: Maha farmer killed by tiger while watering crops in his farm
90.article_body: A 67-year-old farmer in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district was mauled to death by a tiger after he went to his farm to water his crops. The incident took place in the Brahmapuri forest division on Saturday. The farmer was dragged over a distance of 200 metres by the tiger and his body was found near the Wainganga river, an official said.

91.title: Sri Lankan protesters demand justice for victims of 2019 attacks
91.article_body: A group of protesters in Sri Lanka on Sunday demanded justice for the victims of the suicide bombings on Easter Sunday in 2019. The protesters lit candles and displayed banners and placards during a silent protest in the capital, Colombo. The protesters demanded the government uncover what they called the real conspirators behind the attacks.

92.title: Delhi records over 500 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 4.21%
92.article_body: Delhi on Sunday reported 517 fresh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, as compared to 461 cases recorded in the national capital on Saturday. The city also saw 261 COVID-19 recoveries and zero related deaths in the last 24 hours. The city's positivity rate on Sunday was at 4.21% as compared to 5.33% on Saturday.

93.title: Either I can’t sleep or I sleep for 10-12 hrs: Sonam on pregnancy
93.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, speaking about her pregnancy, has said that it has been "very tough" for her. "Your body changes every week, every day, and there are new experiences," she stated. Sonam further said, "Sometimes I can't sleep because I am running to the loo or I'm like sleeping for 10-12 hours and nobody can wake me up."

94.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman to travel to US on official visit tonight
94.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will embark on an official visit to the United States late tonight, the Ministry of Finance said on Sunday. During her visit, Sitharaman will attend the spring meetings of the IMF and the World Bank and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governor meeting. She will also hold one-on-one meetings with CEOs of various companies.

95.title: Priority to curtail rumours: Delhi Police on Jahangirpuri violence
95.article_body: Special Commissioner of Police Dependra Pathak, while talking about the Jahangirpuri violence said that the police are on high alert and their priority is to "curtail rumours". "An adequate number of police officials are present at the location. So far, 20 accused have been arrested and two juveniles have been apprehended," Pathak further said.

96.title: Loved the violence: Shehnaaz Gill on 'KGF: Chapter 2'
96.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill, taking to Twitter, praised actor Yash's 'KGF: Chapter 2' and wrote, "Congratulations, I love you all." She further wrote, "Loved the violence Yash. Peace out." Shehnaaz then congratulated Srinidhi Shetty, Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon and the film's director Prashanth Neel. Yash replied to Shehnaaz's tweet and commented, "Thank you."

97.title: Vital that friends stick together amid threats to peace: UK PM ahead of India visit
97.article_body: Ahead of his visit to India on April 21, UK PM Boris Johnson tweeted, "As we face threats to our peace and prosperity from autocratic states, it is vital that democracies and friends stick together." The visit is aimed at deepening "the long-term partnership between our countries", Johnson said, adding, "India...is a highly valued strategic partner for the UK."

98.title: Would've been fun: Josh on almost playing Batman in Snyder's film
98.article_body: Actor Josh Brolin, talking about almost playing DC superhero Batman in Zack Snyder's 'Batman v Superman', said wanted to do the role, however, Snyder didn't see him fit for the role. "That was his decision...Honestly, that would have been a fun deal, and maybe I'll do it when I'm 80," he stated. Josh played Thanos in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

99.title: Akshay has magnetic personality & an amazing aura: Magician Rahul
99.article_body: Magician Rahul Kharbanda, who taught illusions to actor Akshay Kumar in 'Atrangi Re', has said, "It's been one of the unforgettable experiences of my magic career." "Akshay has a magnetic personality and an amazing aura," he added. Rahul further said that Akshay was "very quick on adapting most of the props and executed them with finesse".

100.title: More would be injured had we not intervened: Policeman on Delhi violence
100.article_body: Sub-inspector of Police Meda Lal Meena, who sustained a bullet injury during the Jahangirpuri violence, said that more people would've been injured had police not intervened. He said that the rally were shouting 'Jai Shri Ram' when they reached the C block mosque. Meena added that the officers had to intervene to stop the fighting groups.

101.title: Spain seizes 3 tonnes of cocaine from fishing boat off Canary Islands
101.article_body: The Spanish Police said that they've seized nearly three tonnes of cocaine from a fishing boat off the Canary Islands. Five crew members, four Turkish citizens and one person from the ex-Soviet republic of Georgia, were arrested. The street value of the cocaine was estimated to be 72 million euros, which had been hidden in one of the fuel tanks.

102.title: WHO chief Tedros to be on 3-day Gujarat visit from tomorrow
102.article_body: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO), will be on a three-day visit to Gujarat starting Monday. During his visit, he would take part in a few events along with PM Narendra Modi, officials said. He'll join the PM on Tuesday in Jamnagar for the foundation stone-laying programme of the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine.

103.title: It has consistently been the dysfunction of the company: Dorsey on Twitter board
103.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey said Twitter's board has "consistently been the dysfunction of the company". He was replying to a tweet that said the company's board has been "mired in plots and coups...particularly amongst Twitter's founding members". On being further asked if he is allowed to say this, Dorsey replied, "No."

104.title: PBKS are playing an entertaining brand of cricket in IPL 2022: Jaffer
104.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said PBKS are playing the most aggressive and entertaining cricket in IPL 2022, adding they end up scoring 190 even if they keep losing wickets. "But, if they don't lose wickets...play their brand of cricket, then you might see...totals of 220-225 posted by them," he added. PBKS were bowled out for 151 in 20 overs against SRH today.

105.title: 3-yr-old Shahid said he loves me as much as God loves man: Pankaj
105.article_body: Veteran actor Pankaj Kapur appeared on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' along with his son Shahid Kapoor, saying that Shahid was philosophical ever since he was young. "He was around 3-3.5 years old...he said 'Baba do you know how much I love you?...Jitna Khuda apne bando se karta hai (As much as God loves his children)'," the actor said.

106.title: Massive fire at Haryana chemical plant, firefighters from Delhi called in
106.article_body:
A massive fire broke out at a chemical factory in the Kundli area in Haryana's Sonipat on Sunday.
The Delhi Fire Service has also sent its firefighters to the spot for the operation on a special request from the Haryana government. The cause of the fire is not yet known, the Delhi Fire Service said.

107.title: Haven't thought that far but T20 WC remains at back of my mind: KKR's Umesh
107.article_body: KKR pacer Umesh Yadav, who has taken 10 wickets from six matches in IPL 2022, said he hasn't been thinking far ahead but 2022 T20 World Cup remains at the back of his mind. "It'll all depend on the selectors and the team management...but as a cricketer, I set small goals and try to achieve those in phases," he added.

108.title: Corruption and Congress are synonyms: BJP chief JP Nadda
108.article_body: BJP President Jagat Prakash Nadda on Sunday said corruption and Congress are synonyms. "Where there is BJP, there is a mission; where there is Congress, there is a commission," Nadda said while speaking at the Karyakarta Samavesh in Karnataka. "Even under adverse conditions, India is ready to make economic leaps under Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership," he added.

109.title: Death toll from flooding in South Africa rises to 443
109.article_body: The death toll from flooding in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province rose to 443, the provincial Premier said on Sunday. At least 63 people are missing, Sihle Zikalala added. The floods have left thousands homeless, knocked out power and water services and disrupted operations at the port of Durban, one of Africa's busiest ports.

110.title: Russian Navy chief meets crew of sunken warship Moskva
110.article_body: The head of the Russian Navy, Admiral Nikolay Yevmenov, has met with the crew members of the sunken warship Moskva, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. The crew would continue to serve in the Navy, it added. Ukraine said that its missile strike had sunk the flagship of Russia's Black Sea fleet, a claim that was not confirmed by Russia.

111.title: BJP govt ruined health services in UP, poor dying: Akhilesh
111.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday accused the ruling BJP of "ruining" the health services in Uttar Pradesh, alleging that the poor are "dying" due to lack of treatment. "People were orphaned during the COVID-19 pandemic. Even today, there is no sign of improvement and chaos is prevailing," he alleged.

112.title: Auto, taxi drivers in Delhi to go on strike tomorrow demanding hike in fares
112.article_body: Various unions of auto, taxi and minibus drivers in Delhi will go on strike on Monday demanding a cut in CNG prices and a hike in fares. Sarvodaya Driver Association Delhi, whose members also drive for cab aggregators, said it'll go on an indefinite strike. The Delhi government has said it's setting up a committee to consider revising the fares.

113.title: Evergreen's 'Ever Forward' ship freed over a month after running aground in US
113.article_body: Evergreen Marine Corporation's giant container ship 'Ever Forward' has been freed more than a month after it ran aground in Chesapeake Bay, US. The ship's navigational status changed to "under way using engine" on Sunday from being classified as "aground" on March 13. Last year, Evergreen's 'Ever Given' ship got stuck in the Suez Canal, disrupting global shipping for months.

114.title: Like all parents, we feel very nervous: Madhavan as son wins silver in Danish Open
114.article_body: Actor R Madhavan tweeted, "We feel proud, overwhelmed, very grateful and like all parents, very nervous," after his 16-year-old son Vedaant Madhavan bagged the silver medal in the men's 1500m freestyle swimming event at Danish Open in Copenhagen. The actor was responding to filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's tweet, who congratulated Vedaant and asked R Madhavan, "How does it feel?"

115.title: Man buys ₹15.4 lakh registration number for ₹71,000 2-wheeler in Chandigarh
115.article_body: A man in Chandigarh has bought a registration number worth ₹15.44 lakh at an auction for his two-wheeler worth ₹71,000, Hindustan Times reported. The man said he intends to use the number ending 0001 for his newly-bought Activa and later for his car. Over 370 registration numbers had gone under the hammer in the recently-conducted auction by Chandigarh licensing authority.

116.title: Crime Branch of Delhi Police joins probe into Jahangirpuri violence
116.article_body: The violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession is being jointly probed by the Delhi Police Crime Branch and the district police, Special Commissioner of Police (Crime Branch) Ravindra Yadav said. A total of 20 people have been arrested in connection with the incident. Fourteen of them were produced before the Rohini court on Sunday.

117.title: Stuff of dreams: Harbhajan on Umran's maiden over with 3 wickets vs PBKS
117.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to praise Umran Malik after the SRH pacer delivered a maiden 20th over against PBKS in IPL 2022. He wrote, "This last over by Umran was surreal. A maiden with three wickets and a run-out. Stuff of dreams!...Blue jersey coming soon." Parthiv Patel tweeted, "This is serious stuff from Umran. Pace and accuracy."

118.title: What happened after slap was disturbing: Jay Leno on Will slapping Chris
118.article_body: Speaking about actor Will Smith slapping comedian-actor Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars, comedian Jay Leno said that the slap wasn't the most disturbing thing. "Because he was kind of smirking after he slapped Rock. It was the yelling of the obscenities. Then you go, 'Whoa. What's going on here? This is real anger'," Jay added.

119.title: You better know how loved you are: Aditi on Siddharth's b'day
119.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari, taking to Instagram, wished actor Siddharth on his birthday. She shared a picture with Siddharth and wrote, "Happy birthday my pixie boy...Always be magic, mad and full of laughter. Always be you...Thank you for the unending laughter and adventures!" The actress further wrote, "You better know how loved you are."

120.title: Leonardo said 'Go ahead': Amy on joke about his girlfriends at Oscars
120.article_body: Comedian Amy Schumer has revealed actor Leonardo DiCaprio's reaction to her joke that she cracked while hosting the Oscars 2022. Amy had joked, "Leonardo's done so much to fight climate change and leave behind a cleaner, greener planet...for his girlfriends...Because he's older and they're younger." Talking about Leonardo's reaction, Amy said, "He said, 'Go ahead.' They didn't care."

121.title: 56 inches can't mask 56 lakh: Moitra on NYT COVID-19 deaths report
121.article_body: Criticising the Narendra Modi-led Central Government over COVID-19 deaths in India, TMC MP Mahua Moitra tweeted that "56 inches can't mask 56 lakhs". She added, "Lying and stalling data publication doesn't make truth go away." Her comments came after The New York Times report claimed WHO estimated India's death toll to be 40 lakh, nearly eight times the official figure.

122.title: Ukraine sought $50 bn in financial support from G7 nations: Official
122.article_body: Ukraine has sought $50 billion in financial support from G7 countries to help it cover a war-linked budget deficit over the next six months, a senior Ukrainian official said. The official also said that the government is considering issuing 0% coupon bonds to help it deal with the deficit. Notably, all the G7 nations have strongly opposed the Russian invasion.

123.title: Security stepped up post incidents of violence in Haridwar
123.article_body: Heavy security was deployed across Haridwar following the incident of violence and stone-pelting in the Bhagwanpur area of the city on Saturday. "Stones were pelted by unknown persons and the search operations have begun to arrest the miscreants. Yes, injuries have been reported but no police personnel was injured in the incident," Senior Superintendent of Police (Haridwar) Yogendra Singh Rawat.

124.title: We need him in India colours asap, he & Bumrah will terrify the Angrez: Tharoor on Umran
124.article_body: Referring to SRH pacer Umran Malik, who clocks 150-kmph mark regularly, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "We need him in India colours asap. What a phenomenal talent." He added, "Blood him before he burns out...Take him to England for the Test match greentop. He and Bumrah bowling in tandem will terrify the Angrez!" Umran took four wickets against PBKS today.

125.title: Facing Umran Malik in nets is a nightmare: SRH batter Glenn Phillips
125.article_body: SRH batter Glenn Phillips said facing his teammate Umran Malik in the nets is a nightmare for him. "I've got my chest guard on (during net sessions) to not get hurt. Imagine what those balls (in the game) will be feeling out there," Glenn added. The pacer has scalped nine wickets in six games in the IPL 2022 so far.

126.title: Shanghai outbreak stalls plans for 3rd aircraft carrier: Report
126.article_body: A COVID-19 lockdown in Shanghai may affect the launch of China's third aircraft carrier, according to a report. The Chinese navy was widely expected to launch the aircraft carrier around its 73rd anniversary on April 23. "But the plan faces delay as the rampant pandemic...has delayed the transport of some key components," a source quoted by the report said.

127.title: Ranbir's brother-in-law Bharat shares new pics from Ranbir-Alia's wedding
127.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor's brother-in-law and entrepreneur Bharat Sahni, who is married to Ranbir's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni, took to Instagram on Sunday to share new pictures from Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding ceremonies. "Last few days have been straight out of a fairytale," Sahni wrote. He added, "Congratulations to the beautiful couple."

128.title: 195-shot rally takes place during women's doubles badminton match
128.article_body: South Korea's Baek Ha Na and Lee Yu Rim won a marathon battle against China's Du Yue and Li Wen Mei to enter the final of the 2022 Gwangju YONEX Korea Masters. While there were several rallies that went over 50 shots during the women's doubles badminton game, a "record-breaking" 195-shot rally also took place during the game.

129.title: Smuggled gold worth ₹1.58 crore seized in MP's Indore, 5 arrested
129.article_body: A Directorate of Revenue Intelligence unit seized 3 kg gold worth ₹1.58 crore after intercepting a car on the Mumbai-Agra highway near MP's Indore. Three smuggled gold bars were recovered from a specially built cavity in the car and all four occupants were arrested. A jeweller, who allegedly supplied the bars, was also arrested after the four revealed his location.

130.title: BJP gave money to woo voters during Kolhapur by-polls: Maha MoS
130.article_body: Maharashtra Minister of State for Home (Urban) Satej Patil said BJP ran a vicious campaign and distributed money to woo voters during the recently concluded Kolhapur North by-polls. Adding that BJP also gave free tickets of 'The Kashmir Files', Patil said, "Voters didn't succumb to such tactics as they voted for Maha Vikas Aghadi. This victory...belongs to people of Kolhapur."

131.title: 2 prime accused of Jahangirpuri violence sent to 1-day police custody
131.article_body: A Delhi court on Sunday sent two prime accused in the Jahangirpuri violence during a Hanuman Jayanti procession to police custody for one day. The key accused Ansar and Aslam will be produced before the court later, advocate Vikas Verma said. The remaining 12 accused in this case have been sent to judicial custody for 14 days, he added.

132.title: Man caught on camera firing gun during violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri
132.article_body: An unidentified man was caught on camera firing a gun during the violence that broke out in Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti rally on Saturday. As per reports, Delhi Police is trying to ascertain his identity. So far, 20 people have been arrested and two juveniles have been apprehended over the incident and firearms and swords have been seized.

133.title: SRH become first team to win four matches in a row in IPL 2022, defeat PBKS
133.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) have become the first team to win four matches in a row in IPL 2022. SRH defeated PBKS by seven wickets to move to the fourth position on the points table. Aiden Markram and Nicholas Pooran registered an unbeaten 75-run partnership to help SRH chase down the 152-run target in 18.5 overs.

134.title: When I first saw Umran bowl, he reminded me of Waqar: Irfan Pathan
134.article_body: Recalling when he first saw Umran Malik bowl, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has said that the 22-year-old reminded him of former Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis. Umran was noticed by Irfan when they were part of the Jammu and Kashmir team. Irfan was a player and mentor in the team. Later, Umran made his IPL debut in 2021 for SunRisers Hyderabad.

135.title: Drunk policeman slaps 2 blind men, breaks walking stick in Chennai
135.article_body: A drunk police constable in Chennai allegedly slapped two blind men and broke their walking stick after they asked him for directions. The constable was not in uniform and was wearing plain clothes when the alleged incident took place, reports said. The victims raised an alarm after which a case was registered against him by the Triplicane Police Station.

136.title: Wanted to improve quality of sleep: Richa on physical transformation
136.article_body: Richa Chadha, speaking about her physical transformation, has said, "I wanted to become healthier, overall. I wanted the quality of my sleep, movement, exercise and mobility to improve." She further stated, "Too much exercise can damage your insides and be counter-productive to your effort." Richa added that rest is "underrated" but very important for the body.

137.title: Rashid captaining GT vs CSK as Hardik misses out due to groin stiffness, playing XIs out
137.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) won the toss and elected to bowl first against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday. GT are being led by Rashid Khan in the match as Hardik Pandya misses out due to stiffness in his groin. GT have included Alzarri Joseph and Wriddhiman Saha in their playing XI.

138.title: Sonu Sood pens note for his father on his birth anniversary
138.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood on Sunday took to Instagram to pen a note for his late father on his birth anniversary. The actor wrote, "Like I always used to say there is no life without you and this I realise every second of my life. Wish you were around to guide us...Be with us till I see you again."

139.title: I back my yorkers, bowl with 100% effort even in practice sessions: Avesh
139.article_body: Disclosing reason behind his successful yorkers during death overs in IPL 2022, LSG pacer Avesh Khan said he backs his yorkers in practice sessions and bowls with 100% effort even there. "If you miss the yorker, then...batter has a good chance to hit the ball for a boundary," he added. Avesh has taken 11 wickets from six matches so far.

140.title: 72-yr-old devotee from Chhattisgarh dies at Puri's Jagannath Temple
140.article_body: A 72-year-old devotee from Chhattisgarh died at the Jagannath Temple in Odisha's Puri moments after he paid obeisance at the shrine on Sunday morning. He had come to the temple along with his family at around 10 am. After darshan of deities, he sat on the stairs where he suddenly collapsed.

141.title: Stones pelted during Hanuman Jayanti rally in Haridwar, 114 booked
141.article_body: As many as 114 people were booked after stones were pelted during a rally on Hanuman Jayanti at a village in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Saturday. The incident was reported in Bhagwanpur area. Police said the situation was brought under control in a short time and Provincial Armed Constabulary along with state policemen have been deployed in and around the village.

142.title: Campus Activewear IPO expected to be launched in May: Reports
142.article_body: Campus Activewear's IPO is expected to be launched in May 2022, according to reports. The company plans to sell 5.1 crore shares that'll be offered for sale by promoters and investors. The money raised will go to shareholders and Campus won't receive any of the funds. It had received market regulator SEBI's nod for the IPO launch in March.

143.title: Ranbir Kapoor returns to work 2 days after wedding with Alia Bhatt
143.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor was spotted going into the T-Series office in Mumbai's Andheri on Sunday. The actor got married to actress Alia Bhatt on April 14 followed by a post-wedding party on Saturday. In a video shared by a journalist account, Ranbir can be seen giving a thumbs up to the media persons who congratulated him for the wedding.

144.title: Former AAP HP chief 'characterless', was about to be terminated: Sisodia
144.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Saturday called Aam Aadmi Party's Himachal Pradesh unit president Anup Kesari "characterless" and said that he was about to be terminated. He also criticised the BJP for inducting Kesari, who allegedly has complaints against him and talks ill of women. "That is his rightful place," Sisodia further said.

145.title: Shaheen Afridi is the number 1 bowler for me: Babar Azam
145.article_body: Praising pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said his fellow countryman is the number one bowler for him. "The way he [Shaheen] works and performs, he has to go further ahead [in his career]," he added. Shaheen, who made his international debut in 2018, has taken 201 wickets in 94 international matches across formats so far.

146.title: Which Indian crypto exchanges recently disabled UPI and other payment options?
146.article_body: Indian crypto exchange CoinSwitch Kuber recently disabled all modes of payments for purchasing crypto on its platform. WazirX and CoinDCX announced that rupee deposits through MobiKwik have been temporarily suspended. While BuyUcoin Co-founder Atulya Bhatt said the platform has halted UPI payments, Mudrex CEO Edul Patel told Bloomberg that Indian payment gateways have started withdrawing support.

147.title: Kim Jong-un observes N Korea's missile test, gives 'important instructions'
147.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un observed the test-firing of a new type of tactical guided weapon, state news agency KCNA said. "It's of great significance in improving the firepower of the frontline long-range artillery units and enhancing the efficiency in the operation of tactical nukes," KCNA added. It also said that Kim "gave important instructions" on strengthening the defence capabilities.

148.title: Ukraine-returned students protest in Delhi, seek admission in India
148.article_body: Students who returned from Ukraine, along with their parents staged a protest at Delhi's Jantar Mantar demanding admission to Indian institutions. "The government should save our children's careers the way they saved their lives and brought them back from Ukraine," said one of the parents. Over 20,000 Indian students returned to India after the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

149.title: 4 wickets fall in an over in IPL without any runs scored for 1st time ever
149.article_body: The SRH-PBKS match in IPL 2022 marked the first instance of four wickets falling in an over in IPL without any runs scored. SRH fast bowler Umran Malik took three wickets without conceding any run in PBKS' 20th over. SRH took another wicket on the last delivery through run-out. Umran recorded bowling figures of 4-1-28-4 in the match.

150.title: Dinesh Karthik has presented strong case for India comeback: Kohli
150.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli, talking about Dinesh Karthik's current form in IPL 2022, has said that the 36-year-old wicketkeeper has presented a strong case for India comeback. This comes after Karthik had said that he plans to be part of the Team India squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Karthik has scored 197 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

151.title: Myanmar junta frees over 1,600 prisoners in annual tradition
151.article_body: Myanmar's military government on Sunday announced the release of 1,619 prisoners, including 42 foreigners, to mark the new year in the country. The prisoners were released "to bring joy for the people and address humanitarian concerns", a senior official said. Notably, political prisoners were not included among those pardoned in the annual tradition.

152.title: Important for MI to keep dressing room environment in good shape: Ojha
152.article_body: Following Mumbai Indians' six consecutive defeats in the ongoing IPL 2022, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said that the franchise should keep the dressing room environment healthy. "It is important is how you navigate the dressing room atmosphere. I'm saying this because MI have always kept it good," he added. Ojha had earlier won two IPL trophies with MI.

153.title: Will continue to respond strongly to wilful misconduct: Sequoia
153.article_body: Sequoia Capital on Sunday said it'll continue to respond strongly to wilful misconduct or fraud. "We will take tough calls where needed in the interest of doing what is right...We will continue to have zero tolerance towards proven wrongdoing," it added. Sequoia is the largest shareholder in fintech firm BharatPe and owns a stake in CoinSwitch and CredAvenue, among others.

154.title: Man fired for being angry over unwanted birthday party gets ₹3.4cr in damages in US
154.article_body: An American man has won $450,000 (₹3.4 crore) in damages after suing his former employers for allegedly firing him for being "angry" that his office threw him a surprise birthday party. Kevin Berling, who suffers from an anxiety disorder that gives him panic attacks, had told his bosses he didn't want a surprise birthday party but got one anyway.

155.title: Police uses drones to patrol Jamia Nagar, Jasola after Delhi violence
155.article_body: Delhi Police uses drone cameras for patrolling in Jamia Nagar and Jasola to ensure law and order in the areas a day after violence was reported during Hanuman Jayanti procession in North West Delhi's Jahangirpuri. On Saturday, stones were pelted following an argument during the rally. Heavy police force has been deployed in the area after the incident.

156.title: Interstate drug syndicate busted in Delhi, heroin worth ₹20 cr recovered
156.article_body: An interstate drug syndicate based in Manipur, West Bengal was busted in Delhi and the police recovered heroin worth ₹20 crore. The syndicate was indulged in the supply of drugs in the Northeast, West Bengal, Bihar, UP and Delhi NCR, said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Special Cell) Rajiv Ranjan.

157.title: Instagram influencer trolls Katrina's cooking skills, she replies
157.article_body: Days after actress Katrina Kaif posted a picture of breakfast she prepared for her husband Vicky Kaushal, Instagram influencer Freddy Birdy took to Instagram Stories to troll her. He posted a series of 'easy recipes' for her to create including chilly cheese toast, boiled eggs and mango pickle. Katrina replied to one of the stories, writing, "This is not easy."

158.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor will not go for a honeymoon: Report
158.article_body: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor will not be going for a honeymoon following their wedding which was held on Thursday, reported Midday. It stated Alia will resume shooting for Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' while Ranbir will begin the first schedule of Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Animal' in Manali. Earlier reports suggested they will honeymoon in South Africa.

159.title: Was surprised with Kuldeep's cricketing knowledge in first meeting: Akhtar
159.article_body: Recalling his first meeting with Kuldeep Yadav, Shoaib Akhtar said he was surprised with the Indian spinner's cricketing knowledge. "He answered...spoke about everything correctly...In fact, I asked him a lot about the legalities and nitty-gritties of cricket and he answered all of them correctly," he added. "I felt weird because he just played five-ten matches for India," he further said.

160.title: MI's Rohit has failed to use India captaincy to up his game: Vaughan
160.article_body: Ex-England skipper Michael Vaughan has opined that Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma has "failed" to use his confidence from India captaincy to help "his game to go really up into the sky." This comes after Rohit's Mumbai suffered six consecutive defeats in the ongoing IPL 2022. Rohit has scored 114 runs in six games so far, averaging 19.

161.title: 2 men held for opening fire at Pataudi civic panel chief's house
161.article_body: Two men were arrested on Saturday for allegedly opening fire on the house of Pataudi Municipal Committee Chairman Chander Bhan Sehgal. The police said that they had recovered an illegal pistol, two magazines and three cartridges from their possession. Notably, Sehgal had earlier claimed that he was threatened by a gangster, who sought a share in his liquor business.

162.title: Woman takes front seat to let Uber driver offer namaz in the back seat; pic viral
162.article_body:
A Mumbai woman's post about taking the front seat to let her Uber driver offer namaz in the back seat during Ramadan has gone viral. 
"Azaan started playing on the driver's mobile...I asked him, 'Do you want to pay namaz?' and he asked, 'Can I?',” wrote Priya Singh. She added, "We parked the car on the roadside for his prayers."

163.title: Mumbai techie cheated of ₹5.06 lakh while paying electricity bill
163.article_body:
A software developer in Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹5.06 lakh by a cyber fraudster who posed as an e-wallet firm's customer care executive. The man was trying to pay electricity bill, but the bill on the e-wallet app was much more so he searched for a helpline number. 
The fraud took place when he called on that number.

164.title: Was saving people when I was hit with stones: Officer on Delhi violence
164.article_body: Assistant Sub-Inspector of Police (Delhi) Arun Kumar, while narrating the sequence of events of Jahangirpuri violence, said that he was trying to save people when he was being hit with stones. "People started running, leaving their vehicles behind. I was trying to remove everyone from the violence-hit area," he added. Police have arrested 14 people in connection with the violence.

165.title: Non-BJP CMs likely to meet to discuss political situation: Raut
165.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday said a conference of non-BJP Chief Ministers is likely to be held in Mumbai to discuss the prevailing political situation in India. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee had earlier written to non-BJP CMs on the same matter. Issues including unemployment, inflation and attempts to create communal discord will be discussed, Raut added.

166.title: Hindu outfit demands arrest of BJP's Eshwarappa
166.article_body: A Hindu outfit named the Akhila Bharath Hindu Mahasabha (ABHM) has demanded the arrest of former Karnataka Minister and BJP leader KS Eshwarappa. "The BJP is using Hindus for the sake of power but is not protecting them. The government should have sacked Eshwarappa, instead he submitted his resignation owing to pressure," said ABHM state President Rajesh Pavithran.

167.title: Ex-Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora joins TMC after quitting Congress
167.article_body: Former Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora on Sunday quit the party and joined TMC in presence of MP Abhishek Banerjee. While tendering his resignation, Bora said, "Instead of fighting against BJP, a section of senior...leaders of Assam Congress have been maintaining secret understanding with BJP government especially the CM." He added, "I shall continue my fight more vigorously against BJP."

168.title: MI is a team of comebacks, expect them to finish strong: Malinga
168.article_body: After Mumbai Indians registered its sixth straight loss in the IPL 2022 on Saturday, former MI pacer Lasith Malinga has said that the franchise has "always been a team of comebacks". "Whether or not they get through to the playoffs...expect them to have a strong finish to the season," said Malinga, who is now the fast-bowling coach of Rajasthan Royals.

169.title: Olivia Thirlby joins Downey Jr, Cillian Murphy in Nolan's 'Oppenheimer'
169.article_body: Olivia Thirlby, known for films like 'Juno' and 'Dredd', has joined the cast of Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer'. Olivia will be seen sharing screen space with Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr, Emily Blunt and Rami Malek in the upcoming project. It's based on the life of American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer and his role in the development of the atomic bomb.

170.title: BJP mentally divided India, worst is yet to come: Cong spokesperson
170.article_body: Congress Chief Spokesperson Atul Londhe said BJP has already "mentally divided" India and Hindus will be further segregated as "upper castes-lower castes". Centre's plans to impose Hindi has also sowed a north-south division, Londhe added. Speaking on the claims that BJP is using central agencies to retain power, Londhe said, "No [Maharashtra government] leaders get any kind of relief."

171.title: ₹10.5 cr wastewater treatment facility inaugurated at Byculla Zoo
171.article_body: A wastewater treatment facility was inaugurated at Mumbai's Byculla Zoo by Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday. The ₹10.5 crore facility, constructed by BMC, has the capacity to treat 5 lakh litres of water. It will be used by the zoo to reuse its wastewater for watering its garden and also for cleaning and drinking purposes.

172.title: Video shows swords raised amid Hanuman Jayanti rally in Delhi's Jahangirpuri
172.article_body: Amid a probe into the Jahangirpuri violence, a video has shown people brandishing swords, pistols and shotguns amid the Hanuman Jayanti rally. The video was reportedly taken while the rally was in C-D Block Market in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where several people were injured following stone-pelting.  Police had earlier confirmed the presence of illegal weapons during the rally.

173.title: Warner-Shaw complement each other well, their combination helps DC: Rajput
173.article_body: After the Delhi Capitals' opening batting pair of David Warner and Prithvi Shaw posted a 50-run partnership against the RCB, former India cricketer Lalchand Rajput has said that the pair "really complement each other well". "The right-left hand combination helps (DC)...Shaw is an explosive player...it’s very difficult to stop him...Warner takes his time and is much more mature," Rajput said.

174.title: Court cannot act as expert in field of education: SC
174.article_body: A court cannot act as an expert in the field of education and it should be left to the institutions to determine whether a candidate possesses the necessary qualifications, the Supreme Court has said. A bench of Justices MR Shah and BV Nagarathna said there can't be any deviation from the educational qualifications mentioned in an advertisement for a job.

175.title: Gang of 4 rob driver, run away with his taxi in Bengaluru; arrested
175.article_body: Four people have been arrested for robbing a taxi driver in Sampigehalli area of Bengaluru on Saturday, police said. The accused persons also ran away with the car and a gold chain. They had booked the taxi at Shivaram Karanth Layout and snatched the car keys when the driver reached the pickup spot.

176.title: Hardik shares pics with MS Dhoni ahead of their IPL 2022 clash, calls him 'My main man'
176.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya took to Instagram to share pictures of himself with former CSK captain MS Dhoni. The duo met each other ahead of their IPL 2022 clash, which will take place tonight. "My main man," Hardik captioned the post. GT are currently on the top of the points table, while CSK are ninth.

177.title: It's been a joy ride: Jaideep Ahlawat as he wraps 'An Action Hero' shoot
177.article_body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat has completed shooting for his upcoming film 'An Action Hero', which also stars Ayushmann Khurrana. In a statement, Jaideep said that working on 'An Action Hero' has been a joy ride and a learning experience. It is directed by Anirudh Iyer, who previously served as an assistant director on 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' and 'Zero'.

178.title: Kuldeep wasn't able to get many opportunities at KKR: Ponting
