178.article_body: Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting has said that DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav was "unable to get" opportunities at Kolkata Knight Riders. "Kuldeep is really thriving in the environment that we...(have created) around him. Obviously at KKR...with the quality of spinners they had...he was unable to get the opportunity that he should have got," Ponting said.

179.title: Which batters have smashed 6 boundaries in an over in IPL history?
179.article_body: As many as 11 batters have smashed six boundaries in an over in IPL history. Chris Gayle and Suresh Raina have hit seven boundaries in an over, while Jos Buttler has smashed six boundaries in an over twice. Pat Cummins and Dinesh Karthik are the two cricketers to have hit six boundaries in an over in IPL 2022.

180.title: Wasim Jaffer names his underrated XI of all time, includes Shikhar Dhawan
180.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has named his underrated XI of all time. He named ex-Australia captain Mark Taylor as the skipper of the side, which features Tillakaratne Dilshan as wicketkeeper. Jaffer also included Shikhar Dhawan in the side. Remaining players are Younis Khan, Shivnarine Chanderpaul, Michael Hussey, Paul Collingwood, Abdul Razzaq, Rangana Herath, Chaminda Vaas and Ryan Harris.

181.title: ₹5,500 got over in 10 days, survived due to shoot for ₹2000-3000 per day: Sonu
181.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood recalled that he came to Mumbai with ₹5,500, using which, he thought he would survive a month. He said that the money got over in 10 days and that he thought he would have to ask for money from home. "I got a shoot for ₹2000-3000 per day so I could survive that journey," he added.

182.title: Will try and comeback again: Rohit after MI's 6th straight loss
182.article_body: After losing their 6th consecutive IPL match on Saturday, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit has said that their side "will try and comeback". "I take full responsibility. It's not the end of the world, we have come back before and we will try and comeback again," Sharma said. He added that KL Rahul, who scored a century, batted "brilliantly" against them.

183.title: We weren't good enough, table isn't lying: Bumrah on MI being in last spot
183.article_body: Following MI's sixth straight loss in IPL 2022, pacer Jasprit Bumrah said his side were not good enough in the past matches and points table isn't lying. "With a lot of games and a little luck here and there, but yeah, it's the way it is. I'm not shying away from that," he added. MI are currently last in standings.

184.title: Pocket watch stolen by Nazi soldier during World War II found; pic surfaces
184.article_body: A pocket watch that was reportedly stolen by a Nazi soldier during World War II has been found in Belgium after 80 years. The watch was crafted in 1910 by Alfred Overstrijd, a Jewish man in Netherlands, for his brother Louis, who was arrested by the Nazis in 1942. The watch was returned to Alfred's grandchildren and it still works.

185.title: Twitter's edit feature may retain copy of original tweet
185.article_body: Twitter's edit button feature may preserve the previous versions of a tweet. According to security researcher Jane Manchun Wong, Twitter's approach to the edit button is "immutable” as it will preserve a copy of the original tweet, along with a list of prior conversations and tag the new tweet as "amended content". However, Twitter is yet to confirm this.

186.title: Zomato defers new food quality policy after criticism by restaurants: Report
186.article_body: Zomato has deferred the implementation of its new food quality policy to May 3 from April 18 after criticism by restaurants, reports said. Under the policy called 'Severe Food Quality' rules, Zomato proposed it would temporarily ban restaurants if consumers complained about their food quality. Zomato has deferred the policy and sought feedback from restaurant partners on the new policy.

187.title: Just 1 or 2 days in office ideal for hybrid work: Harvard Business School study
187.article_body: Just one or two days in the office is the ideal setup for hybrid work, according to a paper from Harvard Business School. "Intermediate hybrid work is plausibly the sweet spot...where workers enjoy flexibility and yet aren't as isolated compared to peers who are predominantly working from home," it said. "Hybrid work is associated with improved worker outcomes," it added.

188.title: CM Kejriwal is an irresponsible leader: Delhi Congress chief
188.article_body: Delhi Congress President Anil Chaudhary has called CM Arvind Kejriwal an "irresponsible leader" after violence took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday. "Kejriwal is just playing the blame game. This is a statement from an irresponsible leader. When Congress was in power, Shiela (Dixit) ji stood for the people and maintained peace and harmony," Chaudhary said.

189.title: FPIs turn net sellers again, withdraw ₹4,500 cr between Apr 8-15
189.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) turned net sellers again after withdrawing ₹4,500 crore between April 8-15. FPIs had been net sellers for six months between October 2021 and March 2022 and had turned net buyers between April 1-8 with an investment of ₹7,707 crore. Apart from equities, FPIs withdrew net ₹415 crore from the debt markets last week.

190.title: Muralitharan picked up 800th Test wicket on his career's last ball
190.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, the only player in Test cricket history to take 800 wickets, picked up his 800th wicket on the final ball of his Test career. Muralitharan, who turns 50 today, dismissed India's Pragyan Ojha as his 800th Test wicket in July 2010. Muralitharan is the fastest to pick 400, 500, 600, 700 and 800 Test wickets.

191.title: 5 killed, 5 injured as vehicle overturns in Assam; PM expresses condolences
191.article_body: At least five persons, who were returning home from a Bihu function, were killed and five others sustained injuries when a vehicle carrying them overturned in Assam's Biswanath. "Prima facie, over-speeding seems to be the cause of the accident," a police officer said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and CM Himanta Biswa Sarma expressed their condolences over the loss of lives.

192.title: Fan blocks Shilpa's car door taking selfie, she says 'What are you doing?'
192.article_body: A video shared by a journalist account is going viral on social media showing a fan blocking actress Shilpa Shetty's car door while trying to take a selfie. Shilpa was getting into her car with her daughter Samisha in Mumbai's Juhu when the incident occurred. She can be heard saying, "Arrey bhai, kya kar rahe ho (What are you doing)?"

193.title: Ranveer stands on table, raps 'Apna Time Aayega' at Delhi wedding
193.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh attended a wedding in Delhi and stood on a table while rapping his song 'Apna Time Aayega' from 2019 film 'Gully Boy'. In another video, Ranveer wore a red coat while rapping as wedding guests danced around him. The pictures and videos were shared on Instagram Stories by fashion designer and influencer Tarini Manchanda.

194.title: Connivance between SDPI and CPI(M): Kerala BJP Vice President
194.article_body: The Vice President of BJP's Kerala unit, KS Radhakrishnan, has alleged that there is some "sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)". "The state government acts like the policemen in old Hindi films. There is a sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)," Radhakrishnan said by referring to the alleged murder of an RSS worker on Saturday.

195.title: Pune liquor shop manager killed for refusing to give free alcohol
195.article_body: A 40-year-old liquor shop manager was allegedly murdered in Pune's Vadgaon Budruk after he refused to entertain a demand for free alcohol and money. The 27-year-old accused had reportedly strangulated the manager in a fit of rage after being refused. He was arrested by police the same day and has been booked under relevant sections of the IPC.

196.title: Inform if suspicious activities happen: Police after Jahangirpuri violence
196.article_body: After the violence that took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday, police have requested people to inform them if any suspicious activities take place in their area or if any group indulges in arguments. “We’ve arrested 14 people, seven cases were filed & weapons were recovered," Dependra Pathak, Delhi’s Special Commissioner of Police, Law & Order, said.

197.title: Pak says its forces facing cross-border attacks from Afghanistan
197.article_body: Pakistan has said there has been a significant increase in cross-border attacks from Afghanistan and that its security forces are being targeted. It added that despite asking the Afghan authorities repeatedly to act against the militants, the attacks continued to take place "with impunity". Meanwhile, Pakistan reportedly conducted air strikes in Afghanistan on Friday, killing  about 40 people.

198.title: Who was 'Mother of Pak' Bilquis Edhi whose death was condoled by PM Modi?
198.article_body: Bilquis Bano Edhi who recently died aged 74 in Pakistan's Karachi was one of the most active philanthropists in the country. Born in Gujarat, Edhi (also known as 'Mother of Pakistan') started a charity that saved over 16,000 unwanted babies in Pakistan. Her foundation had also adopted the specially-abled Indian girl Geeta who wandered into Pakistan when she was 10.

199.title: Govt amends FEMA rules to allow up to 20% FDI in IPO-bound LIC
199.article_body: The government has amended the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) to allow up to 20% foreign direct investment (FDI) in state-run LIC through the automatic route. "Foreign investment in LIC shall be subject to the provisions of...Life Insurance Corporation Act, 1956," a gazette notification said. The development comes ahead of LIC's IPO, expected to be India's biggest-ever public issue.

200.title: We started this as small Kannada project, only Yash had vision: Director on KGF
200.article_body: KGF Director Prashanth Neel, while talking about the film's success, said that the team never thought that they would be where they are today with the film. "The only person who had this vision was Yash. We started this as a small Kannada project and today the film is really big and the expectations are very high," Prashanth added.

201.title: 4 booked for vandalising 3D cinema screen during 'KGF 2' screening in Guj
201.article_body: Police have booked four unidentified persons for allegedly vandalising a 17-feet 3D screen at a cinema theatre in Gujarat's Vadodara and assaulting the ticket checkers while watching the newly-released film 'KGF: Chapter 2' in a late-night show. The cost of the screen was ₹3.5 lakh. The accused had allegedly occupied seats different from their designated ones in the cinema hall.

202.title: 5 injured in shooting outside mosque in Canada's Toronto
202.article_body: Five people were reportedly injured after unidentified attackers opened fire on a group of people at a parking lot of a mosque in Canada's Toronto on Saturday. The victims were leaving the mosque after Ramzan prayers around midnight. The suspects fled in a blue car after the shooting, said police, adding, it could have been a "random act of violence".

203.title: Teacher uses Heimlich manoeuvre to save choking student in US, video surfaces
203.article_body: A video has surfaced online that captured the moment when a teacher saved a nine-year-old choking student who had accidentally swallowed a bottle cap in the US. It showed the boy attempting to open the water bottle when he started to choke. The teacher performed the Heimlich manoeuvre, an emergency first aid measure for upper airwave obstructions, on the student.

204.title: Rajkummar Rao wraps up shooting for 'HIT - The First Case'
204.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has wrapped up the shoot of his upcoming suspense thriller 'HIT - The First Case'. Taking to his Instagram Story, he shared a picture of a clapboard which read, "It's a wrap". "Can't wait for you guys to watch this," Rajkummar wrote alongside the picture. The Sailesh Kolanu directorial also stars Sanya Malhotra.

205.title: De Villiers will be proud watching Karthik finishing games for RCB: Kohli
205.article_body: While interviewing RCB teammate Dinesh Karthik after their win against DC, Virat Kohli told the wicketkeeper-batter that AB de Villiers will be very proud watching him finishing the games for them. "It was an honour to watch you bat again," added Kohli. Karthik has remained unbeaten in five of their six games and has scored a total of 197 runs.

206.title: Electrician dies after getting electrocuted at Haryana Power Minister's house
206.article_body: A 33-year-old contractual electrician died after being electrocuted while rectifying a fault in a cooler in Haryana Power Minister Ranjit Singh Chautala's house. Police have ruled out any foul play behind the death. A cook in the house saw the electrician become motionless after his head fell in the water-filled cooler, following which she raised an alarm, police said.

207.title: Pressure cooker explodes in Ambala jail, 3 inmates injured
207.article_body: Three inmates sustained burn injuries when a pressure cooker exploded in the Ambala central jail, police said on Saturday. The incident took place when the inmates were cooking a meal in the prison kitchen on Friday night, the cooker burst and splashes of boiling food fell on the inmates, police added. One inmate was sent back after first aid.

208.title: Apprenticeship fair for ITI pass-outs in Noida on Apr 21: Officials
208.article_body: An apprenticeship fair is being organised for ITI pass-outs in Noida on April 21, officials said on Saturday. Forty major companies, including Samsung and Yamaha, are scheduled to participate in the fair that will be held at the ITI in Sector 31, they added. "Interested candidates can participate in the...fair between 10 am and 3 pm," a senior official said.

209.title: We’re not only eliminating rioters but will also end such mentality: MP Minister
209.article_body: The state government has eliminated the rioters from Khargone, MP Minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang said. "Shivraj Singh Chouhan-led government is ensuring that such incidents do not occur again. We are not only eliminating rioters but will also end such mentality," Sarang added. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said the state government will rebuild houses damaged by rioters in Khargone.

210.title: Salman ropes in 'Pushpa' music composer DSP for 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
210.article_body: Music composer Devi Sri Prasad, aka DSP, has reportedly been roped in for Salman Khan's film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. DSP, who composed music for Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa: The Rise', has already started working on the upcoming film, reports stated. "Multiple composers will be working on...music of Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali, with DSP leading it from the front," reports said.

211.title: Policeman gets injured after being shot by criminal in Gurugram
211.article_body: A policeman was injured after a man shot at him in an attempt to try and free his accomplice on Saturday in Gurugram, officials said. Constable Gauri Shankar, who was shot in one of his legs, was rushed to a hospital. The incident took place after Shankar caught hold of one of the two alleged criminals following a chase.

212.title: 40th edition of govt of India's 'Hunar Haat' festival begins in Mumbai
212.article_body: The 40th edition of the Centre's 'Hunar Haat' festival was inaugurated by Union Minister Anurag Thakur in Mumbai on Sunday. The festival, which will conclude on April 27, is aimed at promoting ancestral crafts from remote areas of India. According to the officials, the event has provided employment opportunities to over 9 lakh artisans in a span of 6 years.

213.title: Radio Aksh, India's 1st-ever radio channel for visually impaired launched
213.article_body: 'Radio Aksh', India's first ever radio channel for the visually impaired has been launched in Nagpur. Reports said that educational resources that will have a variety of subjects have been made available through this platform. A team of volunteers helps in creating content for the platform that can be streamed to the visually impaired across India and world.

214.title: Several devotees take part in Karaga festival in B'luru, pics surface
214.article_body: Several devotees took part in the annual Karaga festival in Bengaluru's Thigalarpet on Saturday night. The festival takes place every year during the month of Chaitra at Dharmaraya Swamy Temple. "The festival is celebrated...to mark the return of Draupadi in the form of Adishakti, as she promised at the time of her death," BJP MP Tejasvi Surya said on Twitter.

215.title: Hope the drive was worth it: Karthik on viral 'Drove 1,000 km for RCB' poster
215.article_body: A picture of fans carrying 'Drove 1,000 km for you, RCB!' poster in the stands during RCB's IPL 2022 match against DC went viral. RCB batter-wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik, who scored an unbeaten 66 off 34 deliveries to help RCB win, reacted to the viral photo. "Hope the drive was worth it," he wrote.

216.title: Before-after pics show damage caused to Mariupol after Russian invasion
216.article_body: Ukraine's Mariupol City Council has shared before and after pictures of the Mariupol railway station to show the damage caused to the city after the Russian invasion. In his recent address, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the situation in Mariupol is "inhuman". The Russian troops invaded Mariupol, the strategic port city and a former Soviet state, on February 24.

217.title: Day RCB picked me, Bangar told, 'You'll be playing finisher's role': Karthik
217.article_body: Revealing his role when he was bought by RCB in IPL mega auction 2022, RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "The day I got picked, Sanjay [Bangar] bhai called...told me, 'DK you'll be playing the finisher's role'." Karthik hit 34-ball 66* to help RCB score 189/5 in 20 overs from 92/5 against DC in IPL. RCB won by 16 runs.

218.title: I visited doctor for gym injury in chest, they found the lump: Chhavi on breast cancer
218.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently opened up about her breast cancer diagnosis, took to Instagram to share how the cancer was detected. "I had gone to a doctor for a minor gym injury in the chest and that’s when they found the lump," she said. She added, "We investigated it further and further...till we did a biopsy...which came back positive."

219.title: I want to be a part of T20 World Cup 2022 desperately: Dinesh Karthik
219.article_body: Dinesh Karthik, who scored 66*(34) to help RCB defeat DC, said, "I know there's a World Cup around the corner. I want to be part of that World Cup desperately and help India cross the line." He added, "It's been a long time since India won a multi-nation tournament. I want to be that person who's helping India do that."

220.title: Gang using drones to smuggle heroin from Pakistan busted in Punjab
220.article_body: Three people have been arrested on Saturday as Punjab's Tarn Taran police busted a gang that was allegedly using drones to smuggle heroin from Pakistan. The accused claimed they sent drones across the border with sweets and other gifts and anti-national elements would tie heroin consignments during the return, a police official said. The police have also seized two drones.

221.title: Want to record song with Adele, perform live with Taylor Swift: Asees Kaur
221.article_body: Singer Asees Kaur, who sang the song 'Raataan Lambiyan' for 'Shershaah', said that she wants to record a song with English singer-songwriter Adele. "I really want to sing a song with her and release it," she added. Asees further said she also wants to perform with American singer Taylor Swift on stage. "It's a dream," said Asees.

222.title: Doesn't seem like CSK are going for replacement for Chahar: Jaffer
222.article_body: Wasim Jaffer, speaking about Deepak Chahar's injury, said, "It doesn't seem like CSK are going for a replacement." "Now that you've already invested three matches in Mukesh Choudhary so they want to try and stick with him," he added. Chahar was ruled out of IPL 2022 after suffering from a back injury while recovering from a quadriceps tear at NCA.

223.title: KL Rahul fined ₹12 lakh for slow over-rate against MI
223.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul has been penalised after his team maintained a slow over-rate during their IPL 2022 match against Mumbai Indians (MI) on Saturday. As it was LSG's first offence of the season relating to over-rate, Rahul was fined ₹12 lakh, the IPL said. LSG defeated MI by 18 runs.

224.title: Man sets world record for watching 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' 292 times
224.article_body: Ramiro Alanis, a resident of US' Florida, has set the Guinness World Record for the most cinema productions attended of the same film after watching 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' 292 times. Ramiro previously achieved this record in 2019 after watching 'Avengers: Endgame' 191 times but it was broken in 2021 by Arnaud Klein who watched 'Kaamelott: First Instalment' 204 times.

225.title: UP exemplary in dealing with violence: Minister on Delhi violence
225.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has been exemplary in dealing with cases of violence, UP Cabinet Minister Nand Gopal Gupta said on Sunday regarding the incident of violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. “Those indulging in violence have been dealt with sternly and will be dealt with sternly," Gupta said. I don't think anyone has the...daring to indulge in violence in UP," he added.

226.title: Mitchell Marsh was the villain: Kris Srikkanth on DC's defeat vs RCB
226.article_body: Former India batter Kris Srikkanth termed DC all-rounder Mitchell Marsh "villain" in his team's 16-run defeat against RCB. He added that Marsh created pressure for DC by scoring 14 runs off 24 deliveries. "Come on Mitch, you should have thought it out or just retired out," he added.

227.title: Twitter board may be concerned about other bidders: Musk on 'poison pill' move
227.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the Twitter board might have adopted the shareholder rights plan, or 'poison pill', out of concern about "other potential bidders" than just him. Musk was replying to a tweet saying the board has rejected Musk's offer to buy Twitter "20% above market value" by adopting the defensive strategy and also "threatened" to dilute shareholders' stake.

228.title: India have Pant, Rahul as keepers, Karthik can play T20Is as batter: Doull
228.article_body: Ex-NZ pacer Simon Doull has said RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik should be included in India's squad for the T20 WC in Australia as a backup batter. "India have got Rishabh Pant and KL Rahul as the backup keeper...maybe [Karthik] now goes into the team as a backup batter. He can bat at number six or seven...even number five," stated Doull.

229.title: SRH to bowl first against PBKS, Mayank Agarwal out due to injury
229.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday. PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal is not playing the match due to injury, with Shikhar Dhawan leading the side in his absence. Prabhsimran Singh has replaced Mayank Agarwal in PBKS' playing XI.

230.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor send cake for media at post-wedding party
230.article_body: Newlyweds Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor hosted a post-wedding party at their house on Saturday following their intimate wedding ceremony on April 14. The couple did not make an appearance, however, they sent cakes for the media persons waiting outside their Vastu residence. The party was attended by Shah Rukh Khan, Gauri Khan, Karan Johar and Tara Sutaria among others.

231.title: Muslims should understand that religion isn't bigger than law: Raj Thackeray
231.article_body: Amid loudspeaker row, MNS chief Raj Thackeray said that no one has opposed the offering of prayers. "Muslims should understand that religion isn't bigger than the law. After May 3, I'll see what to do," Raj added. "We don't want riots in Maharashtra...But if you (Muslims) do it on loudspeaker, then we'll also use loudspeakers for it," Raj stated.

232.title: BJP MLA booked for threatening alleged live-in partner in Navi Mumbai
232.article_body: Navi Mumbai Police has registered a case against BJP MLA from Airoli Ganesh Naik after a 47-year-old woman, who claimed to be in a relationship with him, alleged he threatened her. She said they were in a relationship for 27 years and had a son. She alleged that Naik threatened to kill her and himself by showing a revolver.

233.title: Punjab CM, ministers to visit Delhi govt schools, mohalla clinics
233.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and the members of his Cabinet will reportedly visit government schools and mohalla clinics in Delhi on Monday. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, who is expected to accompany them, had said the ministers will be shown the "remarkable improvement" achieved by the AAP government. Notably, the Opposition has criticised AAP for running Punjab government through "remote control".

234.title: Pune's PMPML to run free Punyadasham bus services on April 19
234.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) will celebrate its 15th anniversary on April 19 (Tuesday) and it'll provide free Punyadasham bus services for all citizens on that day. Other bus fares will be ₹5 or ₹10, PMPML said. "PMPML encourages all citizens of Pune, Pimpri and Chinchwad to join our joy by using public transport on this day," it added.

235.title: Keep doing what you are, are on right track: Pankaj in letter to younger self
235.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi, in letter to his 23-year-old self, said that he was doing the right thing and was on the right track. "You should not regret any decision, in the future too you won't regret it. Even if you commit any mistakes, they will teach you something," he said, adding, "You were always right...following one's dreams is very important."

236.title: PM lying, 40 lakh died in COVID pandemic: Rahul shares NYT report
236.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi was lying about the COVID-19 situation in the country. He shared a New York Times report which claimed that WHO has estimated over 40 lakh COVID-19 deaths in India. "Not five lakh, but 40 lakh Indians died in COVID-19 pandemic due to the government's negligence," tweeted Gandhi.

237.title: Poverty in India declined from 22.5% to 10.2% in 2019: World Bank
237.article_body: Extreme poverty in India declined from 22.5% in 2011 to 10.2% in 2019, a World Bank research paper said. Poverty reduction was sharper in rural areas, dropping 14.7 percentage points to 11.6%, while poverty in urban areas declined 7.9 percentage points to 6.3% between 2011 and 2019. Farmers with small landholding sizes have experienced higher income growth, the paper added.

238.title: 3 arrested for stealing buffaloes from shelter in Palghar
238.article_body: Three persons have been arrested for allegedly stealing buffaloes from a shelter in Palghar's Vasai. Police have also seized a small truck worth ₹2 lakh from the accused. The buffaloes were stolen from the shelter located near Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Pelhar. The accused were booked under provisions of Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act and Wildlife (Protection) Act.

239.title: I agree: Anand Mahindra on tweet calling 10-min grocery deliveries 'inhuman'
239.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Sunday tweeted, "I agree" while sharing a tweet by Pramesh CS, Director of Tata Memorial Hospital, that called 10-minute grocery deliveries "inhuman" for the delivery agents. Pramesh had tweeted, "I don't care how many trolls I get with this tweet...Customers can live with a two or even a six-hour delivery time."

240.title: UP STF arrests man for cheating mill owners on pretext of govt supply
240.article_body: UP Police STF arrested a man involved in cheating food processing firms, across the state, of several crores on the pretext of government supply, senior police officials said. The accused had cheated as many as two flour mill owners and four oil and ghee mill owners since the lockdown was imposed in the country in March 2020, the officials added.

241.title: 'China installed 3 mobile towers near Indian territory in Ladakh', says councillor
241.article_body: China has installed three mobile towers near Hot Springs in Ladakh, the Councillor of Chushul village in Ladakh has claimed while sharing pictures of the purported towers. Konchok Stanzin said that the towers were installed "very close to Indian territory", adding, "Isn't it a concern?...11 villages in my constituency have no 4G facilities."

242.title: Atmosphere spoiled for poll gains: Raut on Jahangirpuri violence
242.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday reacted to the violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession, alleging that the country's atmosphere is "being deliberately spoiled to gain political advantage in elections". "Such incidents never happened before on Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti," he added. Nine people, including eight police officers, were injured in the incident.

243.title: I knew match was fixed: Imran Khan on his removal as Pakistan's PM
243.article_body: Former cricketer Imran Khan on Saturday reiterated his allegations of a foreign conspiracy behind his removal as Pakistan's Prime Minister. He said that he knew the "match was fixed" when a no-confidence motion was moved against him. "This conspiracy against our country...I want you to carefully listen if this was a conspiracy or an interference," Khan said at a rally.

244.title: Having my own iconic Bollywood dance songs is my end goal: Sharvari
244.article_body: Actress Sharvari Wagh in an interview has stated that she can't wait to have her own iconic Bollywood dance numbers one day, adding that it is her end goal. "Currently, I have been learning Kathak and freestyle hip hop almost every alternate day. I have converted a small room in my house into a dance studio," the actress said.

245.title: Indeed: Musk on tweet saying 'If the game is fair, Elon will buy Twitter'
245.article_body: Elon Musk, who has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion, responded "Indeed" to a tweet that read, "If the game is fair, Elon will buy Twitter." The tweet further said, "If the game is rigged, there will be some reason why he won't be able to." It added, "We're about to find out how deep the corruption goes."

246.title: Okinawa recalls over 3,000 electric scooters after recent fires
246.article_body: Okinawa Autotech is recalling 3,215 units of its Praisepro electric scooters to check and fix any issue related to batteries. The recall comes amid recent incidents of electric two-wheelers catching fire across the country. Okinawa said that the batteries of its electric scooters will be checked for loose connectors or any damage and will be repaired free of charge.

247.title: Dinesh Karthik is getting better with age: RCB's Josh Hazlewood
247.article_body: RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood has praised their wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, stating that the 36-year-old is getting better with age. "He's doing it in every game...it's awesome to watch. His knock [against DC] was different," added Hazlewood. Karthik, who scored 66* off 34 balls against DC, is the eighth-highest scorer in IPL 2022 with 197 runs in six games.

248.title: Bullets were fired, people came with swords: Policeman on Delhi violence
248.article_body: A police officer, Medha Lal, who was injured in the violence that took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday, said that people came to C-block side with swords. "Stone pelting started from the C-block side and bullets were fired from there too. I also caught a bullet and went to the hospital on PCR," he added.

249.title: Israeli police enter Jerusalem mosque 2 days after clashes
249.article_body: Israeli police have entered Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa Mosque compound two days after over 150 Palestinians were injured in clashes with the police there. The police, who cleared Palestinians from the area outside the mosque on Sunday, said that they had entered the mosque to facilitate routine visits of Jews to the site. The site is holy for both Muslims and Jews.

250.title: Union Home Minister keeping every minute's track: BJP MP on Jahangirpuri violence
250.article_body: BJP MP Hans Raj Hans visited the violence-hit Jahangirpuri area in Delhi in the wee hours of Sunday. "I couldn't sleep, wanted to go and check the situation myself. Union Home Minister (Amit Shah) is keeping every minute's track," Hans said. "Many agencies and forces are on the case...The matter will very soon be disclosed," he added.

251.title: COVID-19 patients can emit virus in faeces for up to 7 months: Stanford study
251.article_body: In the largest study tracking SARS-CoV-2 RNA in faeces, Stanford University scientists found that patients can shed viral genetic material in their faeces for up to seven months. Researchers analysed samples from 113 participants and found 13% of people were shedding viral RNA four months later, and nearly 4% had viral RNA in faeces seven months after their initial infection.

252.title: There's so much more to do ahead: Salim-Sulaiman on completing 30 yrs
252.article_body: Music composer duo Salim Merchant and Sulaiman Merchant, who worked on films like 'Chak De! India' and 'Band Baaja Baaraat', spoke about their three-decade long journey. "I feel like we've just begun," Salim said. "We started pretty early...and...never thought we'll get to where we are. But there's so much more to do ahead...and so much more to conquer," added Sulaiman.

253.title: Even Lord Ram will be restless over Khargone developments: Sanjay Raut
253.article_body: In his weekly column 'Rokhthok', Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that even Lord Ram would be restless over the developments in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone. "If someone wants to stoke fire of fundamentalism...and disturb peace to win elections...they are sowing seeds of a second Partition," Raut stated, adding, "Stoking communal...fires in name of Lord Ram...is insult to idea of Ram."

254.title: Manipur media threatens to boycott govt, BJP, Cong for not paying ad dues
254.article_body: Manipur's media outlets have threatened to boycott the coverage related to the Manipur government, ruling Bharatiya Janata Party and opposition Congress over the non-clearance of their respective advertisement bills. In a joint meeting between newspaper publishers and media unions, it was decided that the three concerned groups will be boycotted if they fail to clear their bills by April 23.

255.title: 4 firefighters injured while dousing massive fire at Jharkhand forest
255.article_body: Four firefighters were critically injured while dousing a massive fire that broke out in a forest in Jharkhand's Hazaribag on Saturday, officials said. The fire damaged trees spread over six hectares of land, Divisional Forest Officer, RN Mishra, said. It's suspected that some miscreants among those who collect mahua flowers from the forest could have set the fire, officer added.

256.title: Chiranjeevi is a great guy, he's very humble: Sood on 'Acharya' co-star
256.article_body: Sonu Sood, in an interview, called Chiranjeevi a "great guy", and added that he's very humble and very grounded. Sood will be seen alongside Chiranjeevi in the upcoming Telugu film 'Acharya', which also stars Ram Charan, Kajal Aggarwal and Pooja Hegde. He further said 'Acharya' is a beautiful film. The film, directed by Koratala Siva, will release on April 29.

257.title: Not something I've given any thought to: Broad on becoming Eng's Test captain
257.article_body: England pacer Stuart Broad has said he's not looking to become England's next Test captain. "It's not something I have given any thought to because firstly I am not currently in possession of a shirt within the England Test team," he stated. Root, who led England in 64 Tests, stepped down as the Test captain on Friday.

258.title: Russian artist jailed for replacing grocery store price tags with Ukraine war info
258.article_body: A Russian artist has been held behind bars for allegedly replacing price labels at a supermarket with information on Russian attacks on civilians in Ukraine's Mariupol. Alexandra Skochilenko faces up to 10 years in jail for this protest. Investigators have accused her of putting false information that was motivated by "political hatred for Russia".

259.title: Punjab govt transfers 17 IPS officers, 1 Punjab Police Service officer
259.article_body: The Punjab government on Friday issued transfer and posting orders of 17 IPS officers and a Punjab Police Service (PPS) officer. Among the IPS officers who have been transferred is the DIG of the newly formed Anti-Gangster Task Force, Gurpreet Singh Bhullar, who has been transferred and posted as the DIG of Rupnagar Range.

260.title: Muslim community welcomes Hanuman Jayanti rally with flower petals in MP
260.article_body: Members of the Muslim community were purportedly seen welcoming and cheering members of the Hindu community during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Saturday. As purportedly seen in a video footage, the procession was showered with flower petals from rooftops and balconies of homes of the Muslim community members amid heavy police security.

261.title: Singer Millind Gaba marries longtime girlfriend Pria Beniwal, pics surface
261.article_body: Singer Millind Gaba tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend, social media influencer Pria Beniwal, who is the sister of YouTuber Harsh Beniwal. Actress Akshara Singh and anchor Shefali Bagga were among those who attended the wedding. Earlier, Gaba, who had featured in Bigg Boss OTT, shared pictures from his engagement ceremony on Instagram.

262.title: Sec 144 imposed in K'taka's Hubballi after 12 policemen injured in attack; 40 arrested
262.article_body: Around 40 people were arrested after a mob pelted stones at a police station in Hubballi in Karnataka's Dharwad on Saturday night, which left 12 police personnel injured. According to police, Section 144 of CrPC was imposed in Hubballi following the incident. The mob was reportedly angry over a provocative video posted on social media and demanded the accused's arrest.

263.title: Fan photoshops Rishi Kapoor in Alia-Ranbir's wedding photo, Neetu shares video
263.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to repost a viral video showing a fan photoshopping late actor Rishi Kapoor in Alia Bhatt-Ranbir Kapoor's wedding photo featuring Neetu, Bharat Sahni, Mahesh Bhatt, Soni Razdan, and Shaheen Bhatt. Riddhima Kapoor Sahni also reposted the video, writing, "Love this edit. Thank you for sharing." Alia and Ranbir got married on April 14.

264.title: We need to get better in all aspects: Ponting after DC's 3rd loss in 5 games
264.article_body: DC coach Ricky Ponting said they need to get better in all aspects of the game after suffering their third loss in five games in IPL 2022. "Mitchell Marsh was playing his first game...Rovman Powell hasn't fired in the middle order. So, we need to fix some things," Ponting stated. RCB restricted DC to 173/7 after posting 189/5 on Saturday.

265.title: Stone-pelting started from both sides: Police on Jahangirpuri violence
265.article_body: While talking about violence that happened in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday, Inspector Rajeev Ranjan said stone pelting started from both sides. "Procession was underway peacefully...when it reached near C-Block mosque, a man with four-five others started arguing with those taking part in procession," he said. "On...Hanuman Jayanti, there was attempt to create communal tension," he added.

266.title: ₹10 lakh-pipes stolen from Maha water supply dept in Pune; 4 held
266.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Police have arrested four people for allegedly stealing 100 ductile iron pipes worth over ₹10 lakh from Maharashtra's water supply department premises in Pune's Khed. "[Two accused] have prior cases of theft...and two of them work as plumbers," a police officer said. An official said that there were no CCTV cameras or guards at the premises.

267.title: GST Council may do away with 5% slab; move items to 3% & 8% rates: Reports
267.article_body: The GST Council in its next meeting is likely to consider a proposal to do away with the 5% slab by moving goods to 3% and the 8% categories, as per sources. It is also said that discussions are on to raise the 5% slab to either 7 or 8 or 9%. Gold and gold jewellery attract a 3% tax.

268.title: Yash is angry young man India was missing, he fills void Big B left: Kangana
268.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to say that actor Yash is the "angry young man" that India was missing since decades. "He fills that void which Mr Amitabh Bachchan left since seventies....Wonderful," she wrote. In another story, she said, "South super stars are grounded and deeply rooted in their culture."

269.title: Labourer falls from 9th floor of under-construction hospital building in Delhi, dies
269.article_body: A 24-year-old labourer, who was working at an under-construction building of the Lal Bahadur Shastri Hospital in Delhi, died after he allegedly fell from its ninth floor, police said. DCP (East) Priyanka Kashyap said the victim succumbed to multiple injuries while undergoing treatment. Kashyap added that legal action is being initiated in the matter.

270.title: Will meet Amit Shah over Jahangirpuri incident: Delhi BJP chief
270.article_body: Delhi BJP President Adesh Gupta has said that he will be meeting Home Minister Amit Shah regarding the communal clashes in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday. "A delegation of Delhi BJP will go to the Jahangirpuri area and investigate the stone-pelting incident," Gupta said. He added, "This is not a coincidence but a huge conspiracy and the BJP condemns this."

271.title: South Korea reports 93,001 new COVID-19 cases, 203 deaths
271.article_body: South Korea saw 93,001 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, down from over 1.07 lakh infections recorded a day before. According to the health authorities, 203 more deaths were registered, taking the toll to 21,092. As many as 893 infected people were said to be serious, a decline of 20 from the previous day.

272.title: US arrested 2.1 lakh migrants at Mexico border in March
272.article_body: The US authorities arrested around 2.1 lakh migrants trying to enter the country from the Mexico border in March. It was reportedly the highest monthly arrests in over two decades and an increase of 24% from the same month last year. The Republicans attributed the rise to the rollback of former President Donald Trump's policies by the current administration.

273.title: RCB share video of dressing room celebrations after win vs DC
273.article_body: RCB have shared a video of the team celebrating in the dressing room after their 16-run victory over DC. In the video, Virat Kohli can be heard telling Faf du Plessis, "Keep me in the ring...skip," in a reference to his one-handed flying catch at covers. "Dinesh Karthik's knock and my catch are dedicated to AB de Villiers," Kohli said.

274.title: Taliban warns Pak of 'bad consequences' as Afghan civilians killed in airstrikes
274.article_body: Taliban-led Afghanistan accused Pakistan of airstrikes that killed dozens of Afghan civilians in Khost and Kunar provinces and warned of "bad consequences" if such attacks continue, according to spokesman Zabihullah Mujahed. "The Pakistani side should know that if a war starts it will not be in the interest of any side. It will cause instability in the region," Mujahed added.

275.title: Pics from Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's post-wedding party surface
275.article_body: Several pictures of newly married Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor from their post-wedding party have surfaced on social media. They hosted an intimate party that was attended by family and guests including Shah Rukh Khan, Karan Johar, Malaika Arora, Tara Sutaria and Arjun Kapoor, among others. As per a report, the guests were asked not to bring any gifts.

276.title: Uttar Pradesh ATS invokes UAPA against Gorakhnath Temple attack accused
276.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police's Anti Terrorist Squad (ATS) has invoked the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) against Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, who had attacked police officers outside Gorakhnath Temple in Gorakhpur. Abbasi was produced before a Gorakhpur court on Saturday, which sent him to judicial custody for 14 days. The ATS also interrogated Abbasi's father about his son and his activities.

277.title: Isha asked 'you think I can do Khallas', I said 'no one can give guarantee': RGV
277.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said that actress Isha Koppikar had asked him if he thought that she could do 'Khallas'. "I said, 'No one can give that guarantee...it is not a regular item song...It has scope for a lot of expressions...The way she says, Khallas, that is the soul of film, and you will get lot of exposure'," Varma added.

278.title: Govt questions WHO's method after report claims 4 mn COVID-19 deaths in India
278.article_body: The Centre has questioned WHO's methodology to calculate the COVID-19 deaths in the country and said the same mathematical model cannot be used for India and other countries with lesser population. This was in response to a New York Times article that stated that WHO estimated India’s death toll is at least four million, almost eight times the official numbers.

279.title: WhatsApp testing option to allow users to hide 'Last Seen' status from specific contacts
279.article_body: WhatsApp is testing the option which will allow users to limit specific individuals from seeing 'Last Seen' status. WhatsApp's iOS Beta version 22.9.0.70 has added the 'My Contacts Except…' option under the Last Seen section of the app's privacy settings, as per WABetaInfo. Before the update, users were only presented with three options: Everyone, My contact, and Nobody.

280.title: Cosmetics chain L'Occitane pulls out of Russia days after defending to stay open
280.article_body: French cosmetics chain L'Occitane has decided to shut its Russian operations, days after defending its decision to stay open. The company said that its decision followed the "enormous human suffering" in Ukraine. Last week, the brand said that it won’t close its stores in Russia as its staff might face retaliation as a result of the potential exit.

281.title: Ex-Reddit CEO says Musk 'is in for pain if he takes over Twitter'; he replies
281.article_body: Former Reddit CEO Yishan Wong in a long Twitter thread said that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "in for a world of pain" if he takes over Twitter. Wong suggested that Musk won't be able to uphold the free speech ideals of the "old internet". Meanwhile, Musk replied to this and said, "Twitter is way overdue for long-form tweets!"

282.title: Hardik Pandya most impressive among the new captains: Jaffer
282.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said GT captain Hardik Pandya has been the most impressive among the new captains this IPL season. "Hardik has impressed...the responsibility he has taken in batting, the bowling fitness he has shown...even when fielding he has affected a couple of run-outs," stated Jaffer. Currently, GT are at the top of the IPL points table.

283.title: Woman jumps off moving car as man tries to rape her; WB police arrest him
283.article_body: West Bengal Police have arrested a 31-year-old man for allegedly sexually assaulting an ASHA worker. According to the police, the investigation revealed that the man was trying to rape the woman in a moving car and the woman was able to jump off the vehicle. She was found unconscious on Makaibari Road and was taken to the hospital.

284.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts from today till April 21
284.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will be facing power cuts between 9 am to 5 pm from tomorrow till April 20. However, several areas in Whitefield will be affected by power outages from today till April 21 between 10 am to 5 pm. The areas that'll be affected today include Borewell Road, Prithvi Layout, Upkar Layout and Whitefield Main Road, among others.

285.title: Mini Mathur shares pics from Cyrus Sahukar-Vaishali Malahara's wedding
285.article_body: Television host Mini Mathur took to Instagram to share pictures from Cyrus Sahukar's wedding with Vaishali Malahara. "It's...rare to have a wedding so full of love that everyone feels like father of...bride or mother of groom," Mini wrote, adding, "And given that all best stand up hosts were in attendance...laughter was hysterically abundant in every corner of their big day!"

286.title: Ship carrying 750 ton fuel sinks off Tunisia's coast; crew rescued
286.article_body: An oil tanker carrying over 750 ton of fuel sank off the coast of Tunisia on Saturday, authorities said.  While the country's government has activated a "national emergency plan for the prevention of marine pollution", the Environment Minister Leila Chikhaoui said that the situation was "under control". The ship's seven crew members were rescued and briefly hospitalised, authorities added.

287.title: 1st flight between Gujarat's Keshod & Mumbai flagged off by Jyotiraditya Scindia
287.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Saturday flagged off the first flight between Gujarat's Keshod in Junagadh district and Mumbai under the Centre's 'UDAN' programme. "We believe that with this flight connectivity, the availability of commutation facilities will help attract more passengers here (Junagadh) which would lead to an increase in business and tourism," Scindia said.

288.title: People crowdfund ₹25,000 for home guards' comfortable stay at B'luru lake
288.article_body: Bengaluru residents, who had formed an association to protect and restore a lake in the city, have crowdfunded ₹25,000 for a "comfortable stay of the home guards at the lake". Joint Treasurer of association, Mahesh Gune said residents have also planted more than 150 saplings across the lake. "We are...running awareness programme to educate people to keep...lake clean,” Gune added.

289.title: Clashes break out in Andhra's Kurnool on Hanuman Jayanti; at least 15 injured
289.article_body: Clashes broke out between members of two communities during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in Holagunda village in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool on Saturday night. Stone-pelting was witnessed when the religious procession was reportedly crossing a mosque while playing loud music on DJ and people from the Muslim community objected to the music, police said. At least 15 persons sustained minor injuries.

290.title: Rahul Bhatt shares pic of him massaging father Mahesh's feet at Alia's wedding
290.article_body: Rahul Bhatt took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with his father Mahesh Bhatt from Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding. In the picture, he can be seen giving his father a foot massage. "My Capo di tutti Capi (boss of bosses) my dad," he wrote. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "Best picture from the wedding."

291.title: Culprits don't deserve to live in Delhi: Gambhir on Jahangirpuri violence
291.article_body: East Delhi MP Gautam Gambhir on Saturday condemned the violence that broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in the national capital's Jahangirpuri in which nine people, including eight police officers, were injured. He said that the people who did so "neither deserve to be called Delhiites nor to live here." "The culprits will get the harshest punishment!" he added.

292.title: David Warner's daughters' 'heartbroken' reaction after his dismissal goes viral
292.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) opener David Warner's daughters' 'heartbroken' reaction after his dismissal against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) has gone viral. Warner was dismissed for 66(38) in the 12th over. Warner's wife Candice took to Twitter to share pictures of the reactions, writing, "When daddy gets out the girls are heartbroken."

293.title: PM Modi mourns the death of Pakistan's 'mother of orphans' Bilquis Edhi
293.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has condoled the death of Bilquis Edhi, who was called the mother of orphans and unwanted children in Pakistan. PM Modi tweeted, "Her life long dedication to humanitarian work touched the lives of people across the globe. People in India too remember her fondly." Notably, Edhi had also adopted a specially-abled Indian girl who she named Geeta.

294.title: Varun issued challan in Kanpur after video of him riding bike without helmet goes viral
294.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan was issued a challan by the traffic police in Kanpur after a video of him riding a bike without helmet went viral. The bike's number plate also violated the guidelines laid out by the traffic police, India Today reported. Varun is in Kanpur for the shooting of his upcoming film 'Bawaal'.

295.title: Sri Lankan army denies rumours of crackdown on protesters
295.article_body: The Sri Lankan army has denied the rumours of a possible crackdown on citizens protesting against the government amid the economic crisis. "Troops as everyone witnessed in the past few days, have not at all interfered with any of those peaceful protesters or organisations, nor have they acted against the interests of the State," said the army.

296.title: North Korea claims it tested new guided weapons system
296.article_body: North Korea has tested a new guided weapons system that would improve "the firepower of the frontline long-range artillery units", said its state media. It would enhance the efficiency in the operation of tactical nukes, it added. The time and place of the test were not revealed. This comes ahead of the joint military exercises by US and South Korea.

297.title: States in India should create diverse public health management cadre: Centre
297.article_body: States in India should create a multidisciplinary public health management cadre, the Union Health Ministry proposed on Saturday, offering a framework to separate the clinical cadre from the public health cadre, which would lead to more effective public health care delivery. The clinical role would be separate from managerial roles to improve overall efficiency, according to the framework.

298.title: Was out for 10 solid days, haven't felt so sick in my life: Aaron Paul on COVID
298.article_body: Actor Aaron Paul said that he was "out for 10 solid days" after testing positive for COVID-19. "I have never felt more sick in my life. And so we couldn't do the [Weird AI Yankovic biopic] cameo, which I just absolutely was crushed about," Paul said. Aaron reportedly tested positive the day he was to go on set for shooting.

299.title: Don't know what’s happening: Manjrekar on Rohit scoring 114 runs in 6 games
299.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said MI captain Rohit Sharma "looks in fine form" but he doesn't know why the 34-year-old isn't able to score runs in the ongoing season. "When Rohit scores even 20, it seems like the machine is fine. But suddenly...he gets out," Manjrekar added. So far, Rohit has scored 114 runs in six games this season.

300.title: Half-burnt body of woman found in GB Nagar; daughter is suspect
300.article_body: A woman's partially-burnt body was found lying in her kitchen in Gautam Buddha Nagar's Dankaur on Friday. The victim's son called the police after his seven-year-old son found her grandmother's body. The police suspect the role of the victim's daughter, who was reportedly having a disagreement with her mother over ₹15 lakh insurance money from her father's death.

301.title: I am neither anti-India nor anti-America: Imran Khan in Karachi rally
301.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan at a Karachi rally said he is not against any country including India. "I am not against any country. Neither I am anti-India, anti-Europe, nor anti-America. I am with humanity... I am not against any community," he said. Khan's party PTI has staged several protests against the US for an alleged "foreign conspiracy" against him.

302.title: Can't blame him, it was his first game: Pant on Marsh scoring 14(24) vs RCB
302.article_body: Talking about Mitchell Marsh's performance against RCB, DC captain Rishabh Pant admitted that the Australian all-rounder "looked a bit rusty". Pant, however, also added, "[We] can't blame Marsh, it was his first match." Marsh came in to bat when DC were 50/1 in five overs while chasing the 190-run target. Marsh scored 14(24) as they lost by 16 runs.

303.title: Russia tells Ukrainian troops in Mariupol to 'lay down arms'
303.article_body: Russian Defence Ministry has told Ukrainian troops in Mariupol to "stop any hostilities and lay down their arms" from 6 am Moscow time (8.30 am IST) on Sunday. This comes after it claimed that it has cleared all Ukrainian forces from the port city and only a few remained in the Azovstal steelworks. The claim isn't independently verified, Reuters reported.

304.title: Minor fire breaks out at Delhi's Uphaar Cinema; no injuries reported
304.article_body: A minor fire broke out inside the Uphaar Cinema in Delhi on Sunday morning. Nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot after fire officials received a call at 4:46 am. It took firefighters reportedly two hours to douse the fire. It's the same theatre where a massive fire incident in 1997 had killed 59 people and injured over 100.

305.title: Tusshar Kapoor is my biggest supporter in the film industry: Kangana
305.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has said Tusshar Kapoor is her biggest supporter in the film industry. "In this entire film industry, he supports me so much. It's unbelievable. Even in all kinds of fights that I have with film industry people, Tusshar is the first one to support me," she added. Kangana spoke after welcoming him on her reality show, 'Lock Upp'.

306.title: 11 persons arrested for selling illegal liquor in Chandigarh
306.article_body: As many as 11 people were arrested for selling illegal liquor in areas near Chandigarh’s Ram Darbar and Hallo Majra on Friday. All those arrested were later bailed out. The development took place after authorised liquor contractors raised objections to the sale of unauthorised and illegal liquor in the areas and took up the issue with senior police officers.

307.title: Heat wave warning issued for 11 states/UTs over 4 days, list released
307.article_body: IMD has issued heat wave warning for 11 states/UTs over four days. Heat wave conditions are likely to prevail over Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi and Rajasthan till April 19. Himachal Pradesh and Jammu are likely to witness current spell of heat wave till April 18. UP, Maharashtra, West Bengal and Madhya Pradesh might also witness heat wave over four days.

308.title: She's like my daughter, got emotional after seeing her as bride: Alia's driver
308.article_body: Alia Bhatt's driver and bodyguard Sunil Talekar in an interview revealed that he has been working with the Bhatt family ever since the actress was five years old. "Be it taking her to school or...first day of shoot, Alia has been my responsibility. She's like my daughter," he added. "I got really emotional after seeing her dressed as...bride," said Sunil.

309.title: Village in Spain changes its name to 'Ukraine' in show of support
309.article_body: A village in Spain has changed its name to 'Ukraine' in a show of support to the latter country amid its conflict with Russia. A sign at the village's entrance now reads 'Ukraine' instead of Fuentes de Andalucia. Furthermore, a person said that the village had also raised €3,500 (nearly ₹2.89 lakh) for a planned refugee centre in two days.

310.title: Agent seeking visas cheated of ₹26.40 lakh in Noida; 2 arrested
310.article_body: Two persons were arrested in Noida for allegedly cheating a travel agent of ₹26.40 lakh on the pretext of arranging visas for 15 people. The travel agent was in touch with 15 Nepali nationals seeking visas to visit Portugal, said police. The suspects did not return the passports they had taken and refused to return the money, added police.

311.title: Twitter board’s interest not aligned with shareholders: Musk in reply to a tweet
311.article_body: Responding to a tweet amid his $43 billion takeover offer, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that the economic interests of the Twitter board are "simply not aligned with shareholders". Musk was replying to a tweet about board members' stock holdings. The Tesla CEO also said, "Wow, with Jack (Dorsey) departing, the Twitter board collectively owns almost no shares!"

312.title: TRS to hold foundation day celebrations in Hyderabad on April 27
312.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi will hold its party formation day celebrations in Hyderabad on April 27. The day-long foundation day celebrations, which will kickstart by hoisting the party's flag, will be held at the Hyderabad International Convention Centre. TRS President K Chandrashekar Rao has directed all leaders and representatives to be present at the venue by 10 am on April 27.

313.title: Man absconding after killing daughter-in-law surrenders in Thane
313.article_body: A 76-year-old real estate developer, Kashinath Patil, who had been on the run since allegedly killing his daughter-in-law for not serving him proper breakfast, surrendered before police in Thane on Saturday. According to the police, Patil had a firearm license since 2007 and claimed that he needed it against possible threats he may face in the real estate business.

314.title: 14 dead, over 12,000 houses damaged in Assam in 2 days due to heavy storm
314.article_body: Heavy storm and lightning claimed 14 lives and damaged over 12,000 houses in several districts of Assam in two days, according to State Disaster Management Authority. A total of 7,344 houses were either partially or fully damaged in the affected districts on Friday, while 4,768 other houses were damaged on Saturday. Over 21,000 people were affected due to the storms.

315.title: Debina, Gurmeet share post to reveal baby's name, name their daughter Lianna
315.article_body: Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary have announced their newborn baby's name. The two took to Instagram to share a post with their daughter's name and announced that they have named their daughter Lianna Choudhary. A separate Instagram account has also been made for Lianna and she was also tagged in the post shared by her parents.

316.title: Seems like MI are probably going to finish last this season: Manjrekar
316.article_body: After MI lost their sixth straight match in the ongoing IPL season, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said the Rohit Sharma-led side are probably going to finish last this season. "Despite the kind of players they picked [at the auction], I was not expecting them to play so poorly," he added. MI lost to LSG by 18 runs on Saturday.

317.title: 8 Delhi Police personnel injured in clashes on Hanuman Jayanti; 9 arrested so far
317.article_body: Nine persons, including eight police personnel and a civilian, were injured in incidents of stone-pelting and communal clashes during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday. "A sub-inspector sustained a bullet injury. His condition is stable," DCP (Northwest) Usha Rangnani said. So far, nine persons have been arrested in this connection, she added.

318.title: UK PM Boris Johnson to visit Gujarat and Delhi for the first time this week
318.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson will visit India this week for the first time as PM. The MEA said he will visit Gujarat on April 21 and hold consultations with PM Narendra Modi on April 22. The UK said his meeting with PM Modi will focus on boosting economic, defence, security and technology co-operation in the face of shared global challenges.

319.title: India releases 2 Pakistani nationals who crossed Indian border accidentally
319.article_body: Two Pakistani nationals, Sarwar Baig and Mohammad Asif, who had reportedly crossed the Indian border in 2016 and 2018 respectively, have been released by India. The two were released after checking of their papers and completion of custom immigration. Baig said that he crossed the border by mistake and is happy to go back to his family.

320.title: Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private ruled 'false' by US judge, claim investors
320.article_body: Tesla investors have alleged that a federal judge on April 1 ruled that CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets about having secured financing to take the company private were "false and misleading”. In a court filing, the investors who are suing Musk over his tweets, added that Musk "used his fame and notoriety to sway public opinion in his favour."

321.title: Kerala is in grip of goons: V Muraleedharan after RSS worker killed in Palakkad
321.article_body: After an RSS worker was killed in Kerala’s Palakkad on Saturday, Union Minister V Muraleedharan said the state is in the grip of "goons". "I would like to urge CM to rein in all such elements who are creating anarchy in the state," Muraleedharan added. The deceased, Srinivasan, was allegedly attacked by a group of assailants at his shop.

322.title: Police officer suspended after Punjab MLA finds liquor at police post
322.article_body: A police post in-charge in Punjab's Mubarakpur was suspended after AAP MLA for Dera Bassi Kuljit Singh Randhawa found liquor bottles on the former's table during a surprise inspection there. Randhawa said that the matter will be reviewed after receiving medical reports. The suspended police in-charge and other police officers had been allegedly found consuming liquor at the police station.

323.title: World's highest tunnel to come up at 16,580 ft; to connect Himachal, Ladakh
323.article_body: The Border Roads Organisation will construct the world's highest tunnel at a height of 16,580 feet. This tunnel will connect Himachal Pradesh to Zanskar Valley in Ladakh. BRO Director General Lieutenant General Rajeev Chaudhry said that the construction of the tunnel will start by July this year and will be completed by 2025.

324.title: I don't understand it: Sunil Gavaskar on KL Rahul's celebration
324.article_body: Referring to KL Rahul's 'fingers in ears' celebration after slamming his third IPL hundred, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said, "This is something which I don't understand. He is shutting out the noise when he is got the hundred." He added, "You do this when you have scored four, five, six runs. When you get a hundred, you enjoy the applause."

325.title: People went from calling me 'charsi' to 'kya body hai': Sanjay Dutt
325.article_body: Recalling the time when he recovered from drug addiction, actor Sanjay Dutt said, "When I came back from rehab, people used to call me charsi." He added, "And I thought...'This is wrong...I'd have to do something.' So I started working out. I wanted to break through that. And then from charsi...it became a guy with swag and 'kya body hai'."

326.title: Ukraine's richest man Rinat Akhmetov vows to rebuild Mariupol post-war
326.article_body: Ukraine's richest man Rinat Akhmetov has pledged to rebuild Mariupol where his mining and steel company Metinvest is based. He added, "My ambition is to return to a Ukrainian Mariupol and implement our (new production) plans so that Mariupol-produced steel can compete in global markets as before." According to Forbes magazine, Akhmetov's net worth currently stands at $3.9 billion.

327.title: Started drugs to look cool to women, was in my room or bathroom for 10 years: Sanjay Dutt
327.article_body: Recalling the time when he did drugs, actor Sanjay Dutt said, "I was very shy, especially with women, so I started it to look cool." He added, "You do it and you become a cooler guy with the ladies...you talk to them." He stated, "Ten years of my life I was in my room...or in bathroom...and not interested in shoots."

328.title: India reports 1,150 COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in last 24 hours
328.article_body: India has reported 1,150 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,558, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,751. The country saw 954 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the ministry said.

329.title: Pune to get shelter home for gay, trans, intersex adults
329.article_body: A Pune-based organisation, Bindu Queer Rights Foundation, is planning to set up a shelter home for gay, transsexual and intersex adults in the city. The organisation aims to cater to those who have been cast out of their homes owing to their sexuality. "We are starting with a very small capacity of three persons," said the director of the organisation.

330.title: Fake gossip: Amina Muaddi denies A$AP Rocky cheating on Rihanna with her
330.article_body: Shoe designer Amina Muaddi has denied having an affair with Rihanna's partner A$AP Rocky through a statement she shared on Instagram. Muaddi wrote, "I've always believed that an unfounded lie spread on social media doesn't deserve any response or clarification, especially one that is so vile." She added, "I initially assumed...this fake gossip...would not be taken seriously."

331.title: Mumbai woman who fell off train to resist phone snatcher succumbs to injuries
331.article_body: A 49-year-old clerk of the government rationing department, who fell off a train while chasing a mobile phone snatcher at Mumbai's Mahim railway station, succumbed to her injuries. According to police, she lost her balance and fell off the train while trying to resist the phone snatcher. She had suffered multiple fractures on her head and nose, a doctor said.

332.title: Warner gave us every chance to win, we need to learn from mistakes: Pant
332.article_body: After their 16-run defeat against RCB, DC captain Rishabh Pant said opener David Warner, who scored 66(38), gave them every chance to win the game. "We could've done better in the middle overs...We'll have to talk about doing better as a team, we'll have to learn from our mistakes," he added. DC are now placed eighth on the points table.

333.title: Noida Police on alert, conduct flag march after Jahangirpuri violence
333.article_body: After the stone-pelting incident in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday, the Noida Police is reportedly on alert. The Police also carried out a flag march to establish an atmosphere of faith and security for the public. "I appeal to the public to maintain peace and not pay heed to rumours," Love Kumar, Joint Police Commissioner (Law and Order), said.

334.title: Gauri Khan, Arjun, Malaika attend Ranbir-Alia's post-wedding bash
334.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt hosted a post-wedding party at their residence on Saturday evening. It was attended by Karan Johar, Gauri Khan, Tara Sutaria, Shweta Bachchan, Shakun Batra, Arjun Kapoor and Malaika Arora. Aditya Roy Kapur and Luv Ranjan were also spotted at the event. Ranbir and Alia got married in an intimate wedding ceremony on April 14.

335.title: Mob pelts stones at Hubballi police station; 4 policemen injured
335.article_body: Four police officers were injured after a mob pelted stones at a police station and police vehicles in Karnataka's Hubballi on Saturday night, following which Section 144 was imposed in the city. The mob had reportedly sought action against an objectionable WhatsApp status. The police had resorted to lathi-charge and used tear gas shells to disperse the crowd.

336.title: 29 liquor bottles recovered from cars parked at Mohali hospital, 2 held
336.article_body: The Police recovered 29 bottles of Indian Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL) and four boxes of beer from two cars parked on the premises of Shalby Hospital, Mohali. The cars are registered in the name of the hospital. Two drivers have been arrested in this matter, under the Excise Act, after the keys of the cars were found with them.

337.title: Pune reports 34 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
337.article_body: Pune saw 34 new COVID-19 infections on Saturday with the total case count standing at over 14.5 lakh. As the district didn't report any death due to the virus in the same period, the total fatality count remained at 20,538. According to CoWIN, around 1.79 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in the district.

338.title: No matter how well I perform, he will win with expressions: Ram Charan on dad
338.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said that his problem is that no matter how well he performs, his dad and actor Chiranjeevi will win over the audiences with his grace and expressions. Meanwhile, Chiranjeevi said that he was tensed and thought how would he match steps with Ram Charan in the song 'Bhale Bhale Banjara'.

339.title: I didn't have a sort of happy childhood, it was rough: Elon Musk
339.article_body: The world’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk while talking about how his childhood shaped his business sensibility said, he "didn’t have a sort of happy childhood". Musk added, "It was quite, quite rough, but I read a lot of books." Speaking about his Asperger's syndrome, he said that might have helped him drive to build Tesla and SpaceX.

340.title: Karthik is in form of his life, lucky to have him: Plessis after win vs DC
340.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis praised wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, stating that the 36-year-old is in the form of his life in the ongoing IPL season. "[I'm] lucky to have him in our side," he added. Karthik came in to bat when RCB were 92/5 against DC and scored 66*(34) to help them post 189/5. RCB won by 16 runs.

341.title: NIA files charge sheet against 3 ISIS recruiters in B'luru court
341.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Saturday filed a supplementary charge sheet against three men accused of radicalising and recruiting gullible Muslim youth into ISIS at a special court in Bengaluru. The trio used to allegedly also fund visits of such youths to ISIS areas like Syria, an official said. The accused allegedly did so through a "Quran Circle" group.

342.title: Delhi man kills his wife, son at home; confesses on family WhatsApp group
342.article_body: A 40-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and 15-year-old son in their house in Delhi's Shahdara. The accused's parents claimed he informed them about the crime after he was called to their house for tea and left after saying he would kill himself. Later, he also allegedly confessed to the crime on a family WhatsApp group.

343.title: Delhi LG assured guilty won’t be spared: Kejriwal on Jahangirpuri violence
343.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) Anil Baijal on Saturday condemned the incident of violence in Jahangirpuri and spoke with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal regarding the matter. "Spoke to LG. He assured that all steps are being taken to ensure peace and that guilty will not be spared," Kejriwal tweeted. Baijal also spoke with Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana.

344.title: Virat Kohli's tweet on Shanker Basu goes viral after his one-handed flying catch
344.article_body: Virat Kohli's tweet on RCB's strength and conditioning coach Shanker Basu went viral after he took a one-handed flying catch to dismiss DC captain Rishabh Pant. The tweet read, "The difference between a good attempt and a good catch is the work you do in the gym- Shanker Basu. Thanks for imbibing the 'Get better by 1%' attitude in me."

345.title: 12 injured in shooting at mall in US' South Carolina; 3 detained
345.article_body: Twelve people were injured, 10 of them by gunfire, in a shooting that erupted inside a shopping mall in Columbia, South Carolina. Three people who had firearms have been detained in connection with the shooting at Columbiana Centre, Columbia Police Chief WH Holbrook said. He said at least one of those three people fired a weapon.

346.title: Imran Khan kept Rolex watches, iPhone among gifts he got as Pak PM: Report
346.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan during his regime reportedly received 58 gifts amounting to over PKR 140 million which he either kept without payment or paid a negligible amount against it. Gifts for which he paid a small amount included Rolex watches, an iPhone and a necklace among others. He reportedly sold Toshakhana gifts worth PKR 140 million in Dubai.

347.title: 21-year-old woman molested by 2 bike-borne men in Pune; FIR filed
347.article_body: A 21-year-old woman has filed a First Information Report (FIR) after she was allegedly molested by two bike-borne men in Pune. The incident had taken place on Friday in the Bharati Vidyapeeth area while the woman was returning home from a gymnasium. The duo had reportedly escaped after the woman shouted for help when they molested her.

348.title: B'luru Police book a dozen private loan app firms for alleged cheating
348.article_body: The Bengaluru cybercrime police have booked a dozen private firms for cheating. Reports said that these firms are being run by Chinese nationals or companies and dupe people by allegedly giving them instant loans through mobile applications. Ten cases have been registered with police between February 28 and April 13. Police said 59 companies have been named in these cases.

349.title: Virat Kohli waves at Anushka Sharma after taking one-handed flying catch, pics go viral
349.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) batter Virat Kohli waved at his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, after taking a one-handed flying catch to dismiss Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. Kohli was seen making the victory sign while looking towards Anushka. Pant got out for 34(17). RCB went on to defeat DC by 16 runs.

350.title: Hyd Police Commissioner thanks team for peaceful processions, shares pics
350.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand took to Twitter to share pictures from processions held in the city. "Both Sri Ramnavami and Hanuman Shoba Yatra processions have gone on peacefully. This wouldn't have been possible without hard work and foresight of excellent team of officers I have in HCP. We thank people and organisers for their cooperation with police," he wrote.

351.title: Was amused there are separate airport, gym looks; later accepted it: Bhumika
351.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla said that she was initially amused by the fact that there are separate gym and airport looks. "Later on, I accepted it. Actors are now putting in more effort because they know they would be clicked," she said. She added that it's the trend now and that one can't do much about it.

352.title: Punjab CM should apologise for violating 'maryada': Gurdwara body
352.article_body: The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee has demanded that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann apologises to the Sikh community for allegedly violating gurudwara 'maryada'. SGPC said his visit to the Gurudwara Damdama Sahib in an alleged inebriated state was against the reverence of the Guru's house. This comes after SAD chief Sukhbir Badal accused Mann of visiting the Bathinda gurdwara while drunk.

353.title: Karthik smashes 66*(34) as RCB defeat DC to go 3rd on IPL 2022 points table
353.article_body: RCB defeated DC by 16 runs to register their fourth win in IPL 2022 and jump to third position on IPL 2022 points table. Dinesh Karthik slammed an unbeaten 66 off 34 deliveries as RCB put up a total of 189/5. DC were restricted to 173/7 as RCB pacers Josh Hazlewood and Mohammed Siraj took three and two wickets, respectively.
