354.title: 8-month-old dies after traffic blocked for Andhra minister's rally
354.article_body: An eight-month-old infant, who was being taken to a hospital in an auto-rickshaw in Andhra Pradesh, reportedly died after police stopped traffic to facilitate the victory rally of newly-appointed minister Usha Charan. Her parents alleged that a half-an-hour delay in taking the baby to the hospital resulted in her death. The incident occurred near Kalyandurgam in Anantapur district on Friday.

355.title: M&M to sell stake in Mahindra Sanyo Special Steel in ₹212-cr deal
355.article_body: Automotive manufacturer Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) has announced that it will sell its stake of over 34.75 lakh shares in Mahindra Sanyo Special Steel Pvt Ltd (MSSSPL) to Japan-based Sanyo Special Steel. M&M declared in a regulatory filing that post the ₹212 crore deal, its holding in MSSSPL will be nil. Turnover of MSSSPL was ₹834.43 crore as of FY21.

356.title: Dozens killed in Pak military raids on 2 Afghan provinces: Reports
356.article_body: Dozens of people were killed in airstrikes launched during cross-border military raids by the Pakistani military on Afghanistan's Kunar and Khost provinces on Saturday, according to reports. In response, the Taliban said that it strongly condemns Pakistan's attacks on Khost and Kunar. A report claimed that hundreds of residents in Khost took to the streets to protest the airstrikes.

357.title: ICICI Prudential Life reports 2-fold jump in net profit in Jan-Mar
357.article_body: ICICI Prudential Life Insurance recorded a Q1 net profit of ₹185 crore, driven by steady growth in new business. Its value for new business for FY2022 at ₹2,163 crore is up 33.4% from FY2021. "In March, we posted the best-ever monthly sales by the company in any year since inception," said NS Kannan, MD & CEO, ICICI Prudential Life.

358.title: BJP broke myth one party can't form govt in U'khand 2nd time: CM
358.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, who was re-elected to the post following BJP's win, said they "broke the myth" that one political party cannot form government after one term in the state. Dhami, while attending 'Ayodhya Parv' in Delhi, further said, "People used to say I became Uttarakhand CM at...wrong time". Notably, Dhami had lost his seat in the elections.

359.title: Guj HC lawyer, friend die after falling off motorcycle on highway
359.article_body: Two persons including a Gujarat High Court lawyer died in a road accident on National Highway 48 on Friday. The lawyer, Hirak Ganguly, was riding pillion on a motorcycle with his friend who lost control, causing both of them to fall to the ground. Ganguly was run over by a speeding vehicle and brought dead to the hospital.

360.title: Man arrested with brown sugar worth ₹10 lakh in MP's Indore
360.article_body: A man was arrested with around 125 grams of brown sugar worth ₹10 lakh in MP's Indore on Friday. The crime branch had received information about a potential delivery of drugs to someone in Chandan Nagar and managed to catch the accused when he tried to flee. The accused later admitted to supplying the drugs in various places including Rajasthan.

361.title: No upper limit on Ukrainian refugees that we'll take: Germany
361.article_body: Transport Minister Volker Wissing said Germany will not set any limit on the number of Ukrainian refugees it will admit. "Germany cannot and will not turn back any refugees from Ukraine," Wissing said. Over five million people have fled Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24. "We have to expect further escalation and be prepared," he added.

362.title: 'Unpredictable consequences' if US continues to arm Ukraine: Russia
362.article_body: Russia reportedly warned the US of "unpredictable consequences" if it continues to arm Ukraine. "We call on the US and its allies to stop the irresponsible militarisation of Ukraine, which implies unpredictable consequences for regional and international security," Russia said in a diplomatic note. US President Joe Biden on Wednesday approved $800 million worth of military assistance to Ukraine.

363.title: 6 terror suspects with Al-Qaeda network links arrested in Assam
363.article_body: Six suspected terrorists having links with an Al-Qaeda network in Bangladesh were reportedly arrested in Barpeta, Assam. "We arrested the six persons on the basis of information provided by a jihadi who was arrested on March 4," Superintendent of Police Amitava Sinha said. Those arrested were having direct links with members of 'Al-Qaeda in Indian Sub continent' (AQIS), police said.

364.title: MI batter Dewald Brevis reminds me of Kevin Pietersen: Swann
364.article_body: During MI batter Dewald Brevis' innings of 13-ball 31 against LSG in IPL, ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said the 18-year-old South African reminds him of Kevin Pietersen with the way he dominates the bowlers. Brevis' knock included six fours and one six. "(Brevis is) tall, looks to...dominate with his presence at the crease, (is) a horror to bowlers," he added.

365.title: 3 people accuse TRS leaders of corruption, kill selves in T'gana
365.article_body: A member of the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS), B Sai Ganesh, allegedly killed himself by consuming pesticide at a police station in Khammam after accusing TRS leaders of corruption. In another such incident, a real estate developer and his mother allegedly died by suicide in Kamareddy district. A suicide note was recovered, where the victim accused TRS leaders of extortion.

366.title: Prez Biden nominates Indian-American diplomat as his envoy to Mali
366.article_body: The White House on Friday announced that US President Joe Biden has nominated Indian-American diplomat Rachna Sachdeva Korhonen as his envoy to Mali. Korhonen is a career member of the Senior Foreign Service, class of Counselor, it said in a statement. She also had assignments at the US Consulate General in Mumbai, according to the statement.

367.title: Singapore PM Loong says Finance Minister Wong to succeed him as PM
367.article_body: Singapore's Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on Saturday said Finance Minister Lawrence Wong will succeed him as the next leader of the city-state. "The plan is for Lawrence to succeed me as PM, either before or after the next General Election," Loong, 70, said. Wong, 49, helped Singapore through the COVID-19 pandemic as co-chair of the government's task force.

368.title: Occasional adultery won't deprive wife of maintenance after divorce: Delhi HC
368.article_body: Occasional and isolated acts of adultery committed by a woman do not disentitle her from receiving maintenance after divorce, the Delhi High Court has said. It further stated that only continuous and repeated acts of adultery by the wife would deprive a woman of the grant of payment of an allowance from her husband.

369.title: Lack of partnerships cost us the game vs LSG: MI captain Rohit
369.article_body: MI skipper Rohit Sharma said that a lack of partnerships cost his team the match against LSG at Brabourne Stadium in ongoing IPL. "It wasn't a moment. We tried to put the team before the individual, so we tried to keep...key bowlers in...back-end but it didn't workout," he stated. Chasing a 200-run target, MI managed 181/9 in 20 overs.

370.title: PM Modi praises Gujarat CM for his 'effective leadership' in state
370.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wrote to Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel lauding the work he has done since taking oath as the CM. PM Modi said that the decisions he has taken in the past 200 days for the state's development reflect his 'effective leadership'. In the letter, he also referred to the support received by BJP in assembly elections.

371.title: Drug lord wanted worldwide caught after model posts pic of them kissing online
371.article_body: Drug lord Brian Donaciano Olguin Berdugo, who is wanted in several countries worldwide, was arrested in Colombia after his model girlfriend uploaded his photo to Facebook, police said. The couple reportedly stayed together for a few days in a luxury apartment. The Mexican national, also known as 'Pitt', is thought to have arrived in the country in February.

372.title: Send money to increase forex reserves: Nepal to citizens abroad
372.article_body: Nepal's Finance Minister Janardan Sharma on Saturday asked Nepalese citizens living abroad to deposit funds in domestic banks as part of efforts to preserve foreign exchange reserves. If one lakh Nepalese nationals living abroad deposited $10,000 each in Nepali banks, it could go a long way to help Nepal overcome the current liquidity constraints, he added.

373.title: No question of removing mosque, temple loudspeakers: Maha minister
373.article_body: Maharashtra government has issued instructions against removing loudspeakers from mosques. Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil said, "Loudspeakers are allowed within the permitted decibel limit and if anyone violates that then legal action will be taken." He added, "There is no question of removing loudspeakers from mosques or temples that have taken permission."

374.title: Liverpool beat Manchester City 3-2 in FA Cup semi-final
374.article_body: Liverpool on Saturday beat Manchester City 3-2 in the semi-final of the FA Cup. Two goals by Sadio Mane and one by Ibrahima Konate gave Liverpool a 3-0 lead at half-time. Liverpool have reached their first FA Cup final in a decade. Chelsea and Crystal Palace will face each other on Sunday in the other semi-final.

375.title: Odisha woman sold in Rajasthan for ₹1.5 lakh, 5 arrested
375.article_body: The Odisha Police rescued a woman who was allegedly sold for ₹1.5 lakh in Rajasthan and arrested five people in the case. Police said that the victim, who is married, was trafficked by a woman and two of her aides. "Later, she was married off to a man named Manoj Prajapati against her will," Jharsuguda SP Bikas Chandra Das said.

376.title: Many things to learn from TMC: BJP MP after party's defeat in WB by-polls
376.article_body: After BJP's defeat in the recently held by-polls in West Bengal, BJP MP Saumitra Khan said that there are many things to learn from Trinamool Congress. Khan said, "The inexperienced leaders should be replaced...else there will be more debacles for...BJP." "TMC knows how to play politics...Ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha elections, they'll conduct Hindu festivals for public connect," he added.

377.title: Global warming an issue not only for India but for the world: Birla
377.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla suggested people keep their surroundings safe and avoid misusing natural resources. Speaking at the Parliamentary Research and Training Institute for Democracies programme, he urged the gathering to preserve the environment by using innovative ways. He also stated that global warming is an issue not only for India but also for the whole world.

378.title: HDFC Bank year-on-year profit up by 24% in Q1
378.article_body: Keeping in line with analysts' expectations, India's largest private sector lender HDFC Bank has reported a jump of 24% year-on-year (Y-O-Y) in its consolidated net profit for the Jan-March, 2022 quarter. The lender's gross non-performing assets were at 1.17% of its gross advances, as compared to 1.32% last year. Its consolidated net profit is at ₹10,474 crore.

379.title: It's a special day, special hundred: Rahul on his 103* in 100th IPL game
379.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 103 runs in his 100th IPL match, LSG captain KL Rahul said it's a "special day" and a "special hundred". He added, "I wasn't among the runs but the pitch was good and I made the most of it." Rahul was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in his side's 18-run win against MI at Brabourne Stadium.

380.title: Congress is like a dead horse, no point flogging it: Raghav Chadha
380.article_body: Reacting to political strategist Prashant Kishor's meeting with the Congress, Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha said Congress is like a "dead horse" and "there is no point flogging it". "Congress Party cannot give an alternative to the country. Only Arvind Kejriwal can challenge PM Narendra Modi and BJP," he added.

381.title: Those capable should give up reservation: BJP MP Jaskaur Meena
381.article_body: Jaskaur Meena, a BJP MP from Rajasthan, has said that those capable should give up the benefits of reservation. "I am sitting in front of you as an MP, though I could not even go to school...after becoming an MP, my children do not avail benefits of reservation," she said. Meena served as a Union Minister during the Vajpayee government.

382.title: Taliban asks students and teachers to not wear neckties in schools
382.article_body: The Taliban authorities have asked students and teachers to stop wearing neckties in schools in Afghanistan, a local media report said on Friday. "The...decision...to impose new restrictions on the appearance of teachers and students is not a logical decision," a university instructor said. The order also asked female teachers to wear hijabs.

383.title: Cristiano Ronaldo hat-trick helps Man Utd beat Norwich 3-2 in PL
383.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo on Saturday scored a hat-trick to help Manchester United beat Norwich City 3-2 in the Premier League. Ronaldo scored the 50th hat-trick of his club career. Brighton and Hove Albion beat Tottenham Hotspur 1-0 while Southampton beat Arsenal 1-0. Manchester United will face second-placed Liverpool next in the Premier League on Tuesday.

384.title: Explosion aboard oil tanker off Hong Kong kills 1, injures 7
384.article_body: An explosion aboard an oil tanker in waters off Hong Kong has killed one person and injured seven others, authorities reported. The Hong Kong government had dispatched two helicopters with doctors to transport the injured to a hospital in the city. The cause of the explosion, which sparked a fire on the ship, was not immediately clear.

385.title: Congress wins Khairagarh Assembly seat in Chhattisgarh by-polls
385.article_body: Congress leader Yashoda Nilamber Verma on Saturday won the Khairagarh Assembly by-polls in Chhattisgarh by a margin of over 20,000 votes. Her nearest rival, BJP's Komal Janghel, got 67,703 votes. "The winning of Congress candidate is an outcome of Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel's policies in the state. Our leader took decision in favour of public," state minister Amarjeet Bhagat said.

386.title: Hardik has pretty relaxed approach towards the game: GT pacer Ferguson
386.article_body: Complimenting Hardik Pandya for leading GT in IPL 2022, teammate Lockie Ferguson said the skipper has a pretty relaxed approach towards the game. "He plays the game to entertain people as much as to win the game. I think that kind of attitude breathes energy and life into the group," he added. GT are currently on top of the standings.

387.title: IAF won't buy 48 Russian Mi-17V5 helicopters to boost 'Make in India'
387.article_body: To boost the 'Make in India' programme, the Indian Air Force has shelved its plan to buy 48 additional Mi-17V5 medium-lift helicopters from Russia. India signed a deal with Russia for the acquisition of 80 Mi-17V5 helicopters that were inducted into the force in phases. An additional 48 were planned to be inducted but it will not be done anymore.

388.title: Bumrah told me bowler must be able to do everything his team needs: Krishna
388.article_body: On being asked about how he masters the skill of bowling, RR pacer Prasidh Krishna said he has closely worked with coach Omkar Salvi for last four years and goes to him for any technical advice. He added that MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah once told him that a bowler should be able to do everything the team needs.

389.title: It's response to something else: Joe on keeping relationship with Taylor private
389.article_body: Speaking about keeping his relationship with singer-songwriter Taylor Swift private, English actor Joe Alwyn said that it's not because he wants to be guarded but because it's a response to something else. "We live in a culture that is so increasingly intrusive. The more you give, and frankly even if you don't give it, something will be taken," Joe added.

390.title: Meghan Markle gives her coat worth ₹3 lakh to mother holding a baby; pics viral
390.article_body: Pictures and video showing Meghan Markle giving her Max Mara coat said to be worth over ₹3 lakh (£3,080) are going viral on social media. Prince Harry and Meghan were being escorted to the venue of Invictus Games in The Hague, Netherlands, by competitors when Meghan gave the coat. "Queen of kindness," social media user said.

391.title: Dinesh Karthik smashes most runs in an over by an RCB batter in IPL 2022
391.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik smashed 28 runs, including four fours and two sixes, in an over on the bowling of DC pacer Mustafizur Rahman. With this, he recorded the most runs scored in an over by an RCB batter in IPL 2022. He's followed by Glenn Maxwell, who smashed 23 runs in an over bowled by DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav.

392.title: We are making every effort for 'Munna Bhai 3': Sanjay Dutt
392.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt in an interview has stated that they are making every effort for 'Munna Bhai 3', adding that filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani also wants to make the film. "We've done other movies...we've done 'PK' and may do more such films in future. But when talking about the fans, I'm sure that they're most interested in Munna Bhai," Sanjay added.

393.title: He's done an amazing job: Mercedes' Hamilton on teammate Russell
393.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has praised Mercedes teammate George Russell for the "amazing job" he has done so far this season. Russell finished third in the Australian Grand Prix last Sunday. "He's working and really grafting away, he's doing an amazing job," Hamilton said. Russell is currently second in the driver standings behind Ferrari's Charles Leclerc.

394.title: All-black apartment in UK goes for sale for ₹3.7 crore, pics surface
394.article_body: An apartment with all-black interiors has gone on sale in UK's Manchester for £375,000 (around ₹3.73 crores). Pictures from the unusual two-bedroom lodging showed black marble kitchen counters and black-coloured walls, along with gold-coloured taps and other fittings. The 990-square-foot space is described in the listing, as having 'Gotham City' vibes.

395.title: Curbs in China may delay Apple product shipments: Analysts
395.article_body: Lockdowns and curbs in China amid rising Covid-19 cases have started disrupting global supply chains and logistics, due to which, analysts say that delays in shipments of certain Apple products are possible. Quanta Computer Inc, which produces the bulk of MacBooks globally has shut operations and Apple supplier Pegatron has announced the suspension of its plants in Shanghai and Kunshan.

396.title: Tek Travels DMCC acquires 51% stake in Switzerland-based BookaBed AG
396.article_body: Tek Travels DMCC, which is a wholly owned subsidiary of TBO Tek Limited, has announced that it has acquired 51% shareholding of Switzerland-based B2B accommodation provider BookaBed AG. "We are excited to welcome everyone at BookaBed to the TBO family. BookaBed allows TBO's entry into the Irish market and strengthens our UK presence," TBO Co-Founder Gaurav Bhatnagar said.

397.title: We're happy: Shatrughan Sinha's wife on his win in Asansol by-polls
397.article_body: After Trinamool Congress' Shatrughan Prasad Sinha won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls on Saturday, his wife Poonam Sinha said that they're happy "as the people of Asansol have welcomed them with open hands". She said, "It feels like we are from Asansol only. It can only happen in India where people love each other." Shatrughan Sinha defeated BJP's Agnimitra Paul.

398.title: Violence breaks out during Hanuman Jayanti rally in Delhi, injuries reported
398.article_body: Clashes broke out between two communities in Northwest Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti Shobha Yatra organised in the area on Saturday. Two policemen and others were injured in the incident as stones were pelted following an argument. CM Arvind Kejriwal condemned the incident and appealed for peace, adding, "Strict action should be taken against those who are guilty."

399.title: Lucknow is smiling, why wouldn't they: Irfan on LSG's 18-run win vs MI
399.article_body: Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to praise LSG after their 18-run win against MI in IPL 2022 and wrote, "Lucknow is smiling and why wouldn't they?? Playing high quality cricket!" Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Sixth straight defeat for MI...need some rethinking by the paltan. Great win LSG...in serious contention for the title! It's LSG's fourth win from six matches.

400.title: Ukraine's richest man pledges to help rebuild besieged Mariupol
400.article_body: Ukraine's richest man Rinat Akhmetov has pledged to help rebuild Ukraine's Mariupol after a siege by Russian forces caused widespread destruction in the city. "Mariupol is a global tragedy and a global example of heroism. For me, Mariupol has been and will always be a Ukrainian city," he said. Akhmetov's Metinvest owns two iron and steelworks plants in Mariupol.

401.title: Sri Lankan stock exchange to halt trading for 5 days amid crisis
401.article_body: The Colombo Stock Exchange will remain shut for five business days from April 18, according to the Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka. The move is aimed at providing investors an opportunity to have "more clarity and understanding" of the current economic conditions, it said. Sri Lanka is dealing with its worst economic crisis since its independence in 1948.

402.title: CBI denied further custody of Deshmukh over unsatisfactory grounds
402.article_body: A special CBI court on Saturday denied the central agency further custody of former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh calling the grounds stated by the CBI "not good and unsatisfactory". CBI had sought three more days of his custody in connection to a corruption case. The court sent Deshmukh and three other accused to judicial custody till April 29.
